original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ltar 'jig rten pa thams cad kyis mi shes mi mthong mi rtogs pa dag /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa ltar 'jig rten pa thams cad kyis mi shes mi mthong mi rtogs pa dag /
translated: As the Bhagavat has said, all worldly beings do not know, do not see, and do not realize.

original: byang chub sems dpas thams cad shes shing mthong la rtogs so zhes bgyi ba /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas thams cad shes shing mthong la rtogs so zhes bgyi ba /
translated: The bodhisattva knows, sees, and realizes all.

original: ci ste byang chub sems dpa' yang 'jig rten pa lags na ni /
analyzed: ci ste byang chub sems dpa' yang 'jig rten pa lags na ni /
translated: If the bodhisattva is also worldly,

original: 'jig rten pas ni mi shes mi mthong mi rtogs pa dag /
analyzed: 'jig rten pas ni mi shes mi mthong mi rtogs pa dag /
translated: then it would not be right to say that what worldly beings do not know, do not see, and do not realize,

original: byang chub sems dpas shes so //🔽mthong ngo // rtogs so zhes bgyi ba'ang mi rung /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas shes so // mthong ngo // rtogs so zhes bgyi ba'ang mi rung /
translated: the bodhisattva knows, sees, and realizes.

original: ci ste 'jig rten pa ma lags na /
analyzed: ci ste 'jig rten pa ma lags na /
translated: If he is not worldly,

original: tha dad ba'ang ci zhig mchis /
analyzed: tha dad ba'ang ci zhig mchis /
translated: then what is the difference?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavat replied,

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of noble family!

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'ang yin la /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'ang yin la /
translated: A bodhisattva is both worldly and not worldly.

original: 'jig rten pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: He is not only worldly.

original: gang mi shes mi mthong mi rtog pa ni 'jig rten pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang mi shes mi mthong mi rtog pa ni 'jig rten pa zhes bya'o //
translated: One who does not know, does not see, and does not realize is called worldly.

original: shes shing mthong la rtogs pa ni 'jig rten pa zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: shes shing mthong la rtogs pa ni 'jig rten pa zhes mi bya'o //
translated: One who knows, sees, and realizes is not called worldly.

original: khyod kyis tha dad pa ci yod ces dris pa yang ngas bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: khyod kyis tha dad pa ci yod ces dris pa yang ngas bshad par bya'o //
translated: I will now explain what you asked about, ‘What are the differences?’

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: ji ste skyes pa'am bud med gang yang rung ba /🔽yongs su mya ngan las 'das @418a *//
analyzed: ji ste skyes pa'am bud med gang yang rung ba / yongs su mya ngan las 'das @418a *//
translated: if a man or a woman,🔽as soon as they hear the Mahāparinirvāṇa Sūtra,

original: pa'i mdo sde thos ma thag tu dang pa skyes nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ni 'jig rten pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ste /
analyzed: pa'i mdo sde thos ma thag tu dang pa skyes nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed pa ni 'jig rten pa'i byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ste /
translated: gives rise to faith and arouses the mind set on unsurpassed perfect awakening, they are called a worldly bodhisattva.

original: 'jig rten pa thams cad kyis mi shes mi mthong mi rtogs pa ltar /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa thams cad kyis mi shes mi mthong mi rtogs pa ltar /
translated: Just as all worldly people do not know, do not see, and do not realize,🔽the bodhisattva, in accord with the world, also does not know, does not see, and does not realize.

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang 'jig rten pa dang mthun par mi shes mi mthong mi rtogs so; ;byang chub sems dpa' yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i mdo sde thos nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang 'jig rten pa dang mthun par mi shes mi mthong mi rtogs so; ;byang chub sems dpa' yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i mdo sde thos nas /
translated: The bodhisattva, having heard the Mahāparinirvāṇa Sūtra,

original: 'jig rten pas mi shes mi mthong mi rtogs pa dag byang chub sems dpas shes shing mthong la rtogs so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pas mi shes mi mthong mi rtogs pa dag byang chub sems dpas shes shing mthong la rtogs so //
translated: knows, sees, and realizes what worldly people do not know, do not see, and do not realize.

original: de ltar dngos po de dag shes nas /
analyzed: de ltar dngos po de dag shes nas /
translated: Having known these things,

original: bdag 'di snyam du sems so //
analyzed: bdag 'di snyam du sems so //
translated: I thought to myself:

original: bdag gi ji ltar thabs gang gis nan tan gang byas pas shes pa dang; mthong ba dang / rtogs par 'gyur snyam sems so //
analyzed: bdag gi ji ltar thabs gang gis nan tan gang byas pas shes pa dang; mthong ba dang / rtogs par 'gyur snyam sems so //
translated: “By what means and what practice can I attain understanding, insight, and realization?”

original: yang 'di snyam du de ni shin tu dad pa'i sems kyis tshul khrims yongs su dag par bsrungs pa las thob par 'gyur snyam sems so //
analyzed: yang 'di snyam du de ni shin tu dad pa'i sems kyis tshul khrims yongs su dag par bsrungs pa las thob par 'gyur snyam sems so //
translated: I thought to myself: “It can be attained by a mind of great faith that observes pure discipline.”

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: de'i tshe na byang chub sems dpa' de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis ma 'ongs pa'i dus su gang nas gang du skye ba de dang de dag tu tshul khrims yongs su dag par srung ngo //
analyzed: de'i tshe na byang chub sems dpa' de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis ma 'ongs pa'i dus su gang nas gang du skye ba de dang de dag tu tshul khrims yongs su dag par srung ngo //
translated: At that time, because of this cause and this condition, the bodhisattva in the future, wherever he is born, will observe pure discipline.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshul khrims yongs su dag pas na gang nas gang du skyes kyang @418b rtag tu nga rgyal dang / ngan par lta ba dang / the tshom gyis glags pa med de /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshul khrims yongs su dag pas na gang nas gang du skyes kyang @418b rtag tu nga rgyal dang / ngan par lta ba dang / the tshom gyis glags pa med de /
translated: In this way, because the bodhisattva-mahāsattva observes pure discipline, wherever he is born, he is always free from the afflictions of pride, wrong views, and doubt.

original: nam du'ang de bzhin gshegs pa mthar yongs su mya ngan las 'das par zhugs so zhes mi zer te /
analyzed: nam du'ang de bzhin gshegs pa mthar yongs su mya ngan las 'das par zhugs so zhes mi zer te /
translated: They never say, “The Tathāgata has finally passed into nirvāṇa.”

original: de dag ni byang chub sems dpas tshul khrims yongs su dag par bsrungs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni byang chub sems dpas tshul khrims yongs su dag par bsrungs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the bodhisattva’s pure observance of morality.

original: de ltar tshul khrims yongs su dag pas na ting nge 'dzin la nan tan byed do //
analyzed: de ltar tshul khrims yongs su dag pas na ting nge 'dzin la nan tan byed do //
translated: “Because they observe morality purely in this way, they practice meditative stability.

original: ting nge 'dzin la nan tan byed pas na gang nas gang du skye ba de dang de dag tu yang dag pa'i dran pa mi nyams so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la nan tan byed pas na gang nas gang du skye ba de dang de dag tu yang dag pa'i dran pa mi nyams so //
translated: Because they practice meditative stability, wherever they are born, there their right mindfulness is not lost.

original: 'di lta se /
analyzed: 'di lta se /
translated: For example,

original: sems can thams cad las sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod pa dang / mdo sde bcu gnyis dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang / yongs su dag pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad shin tu rgyas pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo la gnas pas thams cad kyis sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin mthong ba la sogs te dngos po de dag mi brjod do //
analyzed: sems can thams cad las sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin yod pa dang / mdo sde bcu gnyis dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang / yongs su dag pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad shin tu rgyas pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo la gnas pas thams cad kyis sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin mthong ba la sogs te dngos po de dag mi brjod do //
translated: He does not speak of the existence of the Buddha-nature in all sentient beings, nor of the twelve divisions of the scriptures, nor of the permanence, bliss, self, and purity of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, nor of the fact that all bodhisattvas abide in the Great Nirvana Sutra of Vastness and therefore see the Buddha-nature.

original: ting nge 'dzin la nan tan byas pas stong pa bcu gcig kyang thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la nan tan byas pas stong pa bcu gcig kyang thob par 'gyur te /
translated: By diligently practicing samadhi, one attains the eleven kinds of emptiness.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin yongs su dag pa la nan tan byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin yongs su dag pa la nan tan byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the bodhisattva's diligent practice of pure samadhi.

original: de ltar tshul khrims dang; ting nge 'dzin du ldan par gyur pas yongs su dag pa'i shes rab la nan tan byed do //
analyzed: de ltar tshul khrims dang; ting nge 'dzin du ldan par gyur pas yongs su dag pa'i shes rab la nan tan byed do //
translated: Thus, possessing morality and samadhi, one diligently practices pure wisdom.

original: shes rab la nan tan byas pas na thog ma nas lus kyi nang na bdag yod par ram /
analyzed: shes rab la nan tan byas pas na thog ma nas lus kyi nang na bdag yod par ram /
translated: Since they have diligently applied themselves to wisdom, they know that from the very beginning there is no self within the body.

original: bdag @419a *// gi nang na lus yod par mi 'dzin te /🔽lus dang / bdag lus ma yin /
analyzed: bdag @419a *// gi nang na lus yod par mi 'dzin te / lus dang / bdag lus ma yin /
translated: Since he has practiced wisdom, he does not grasp that the self exists within the body or that the body exists within the self.

original: bdag ma yin par mi 'dzin te /
analyzed: bdag ma yin par mi 'dzin te /
translated: He does not grasp that the body is the self or that the self is not the body.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' shes rab yongs su dag par nan tan byed pa'o //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' shes rab yongs su dag par nan tan byed pa'o //
translated: This is the bodhisattva’s practice of pure wisdom.

original: shes rab la nan tan byas pas tshul khrims bsrungs pa rnams kyang shin tu brtan par gyur to //
analyzed: shes rab la nan tan byas pas tshul khrims bsrungs pa rnams kyang shin tu brtan par gyur to //
translated: Since he has practiced wisdom, those who have observed moral discipline have become extremely firm.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this.

original: dper na / ri rab lhun po ni rlung rnam pa bzhis bskyod mi nus so //🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: dper na / ri rab lhun po ni rlung rnam pa bzhis bskyod mi nus so // byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: The four kinds of wind cannot move Mount Sumeru.

original: phyin ci log bzhis bskyod mi nus so //
analyzed: phyin ci log bzhis bskyod mi nus so //
translated: In the same way, the four errors cannot move the bodhisattva mahāsattva.

original: rigs kyi bu /🔽byang chub sems dpa' de'i tshe na bdag gis tshul khrims bsrungs pa rnams cis kyang bskyod mi nus par shes so //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu / byang chub sems dpa' de'i tshe na bdag gis tshul khrims bsrungs pa rnams cis kyang bskyod mi nus par shes so //
translated: Son of noble family,

original: mthong ngo // rtogs so //
analyzed: mthong ngo // rtogs so //
translated: at that time the bodhisattva knows, sees, and realizes that the moral discipline he has observed cannot be moved by anything.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpas shes pa dang mthong ba rtogs pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpas shes pa dang mthong ba rtogs pa zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called the bodhisattva’s knowledge, vision, and realization,

original: 'jig rten pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pas ni ma yin no //
translated: not that of the worldly person.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar tshul khrims bsrungs pa rnams shin tu brtan zhing mi g-yo bar mthong bas 'gyod pa'i sems med de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos de ltar tshul khrims bsrungs pa rnams shin tu brtan zhing mi g-yo bar mthong bas 'gyod pa'i sems med de /
translated: The bodhisattva-mahāsattva, seeing that the precepts he has guarded are extremely firm and unmoving, has no regretful thoughts.

original: 'gyod pa med pas sems rab tu dga' bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'gyod pa med pas sems rab tu dga' bar 'gyur /
translated: Because of having no regret, his mind becomes extremely joyful.

original: rab tu dga' bar gyur pas sems shin tu tshim par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab tu dga' bar gyur pas sems shin tu tshim par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of being extremely joyful, his mind becomes extremely satisfied.

original: shin tu tshim par gyur pas bde bar 'gyur /
analyzed: shin tu tshim par gyur pas bde bar 'gyur /
translated: Because of being extremely satisfied, he becomes blissful.

original: sems rab tu bde bar gyur pas mi g-yo ba'i ting nge 'dzin thob bo //
analyzed: sems rab tu bde bar gyur pas mi g-yo ba'i ting nge 'dzin thob bo //
translated: Because his mind is extremely blissful, he attains unwavering samādhi.

original: mi g-yo ba'i ting nge 'dzin thob pas @419b shes pa dang / lta ba yang dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i ting nge 'dzin thob pas @419b shes pa dang / lta ba yang dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because he attains unwavering samādhi, his knowledge and views become correct.

original: shes pa dang / lta ba yang dag par gyur pas 'khor ba las yongs su skyo'o //
analyzed: shes pa dang / lta ba yang dag par gyur pas 'khor ba las yongs su skyo'o //
translated: Because his knowledge and views become correct, he becomes weary of saṃsāra.

original: 'khor ba las skyo bas na rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba las skyo bas na rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because he becomes weary of saṃsāra, he attains liberation.

original: rnam par grol bar gyur pas na sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin gsal bar mthong ste /
analyzed: rnam par grol bar gyur pas na sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin gsal bar mthong ste /
translated: Since they are liberated, they clearly see the nature of the Buddha.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpas shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / rtogs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpas shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / rtogs pa yin gyi /
translated: This is what the bodhisattvas know, see, and realize.

original: 'jig rten pas shes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pas shes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not what the worldly know.

original: rigs kyi bu /🔽'di dag ni 'jig rten pas ni mi shes /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu / 'di dag ni 'jig rten pas ni mi shes /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: mi mthong / mi rtogs pa yin gyi /🔽byang chub sems dpas ni shes so //
analyzed: mi mthong / mi rtogs pa yin gyi / byang chub sems dpas ni shes so //
translated: this is not what the worldly know, see, or realize.

original: mthong ngo // rtogs so //🔽'od srung gis yang gsol pa /🔽ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' tshul khrims yongs su dag par nan tan bgyis pas 'gyod pa'i sems ma mchis pa nas /
analyzed: mthong ngo // rtogs so // 'od srung gis yang gsol pa / ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' tshul khrims yongs su dag par nan tan bgyis pas 'gyod pa'i sems ma mchis pa nas /
translated: It is what the bodhisattvas know, see, and realize.

original: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin gyi bar du gsal bar mthong ba lags /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin gyi bar du gsal bar mthong ba lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: ” Kāśyapa then said, “How is it that bodhisattvas, by practicing pure conduct, have no regrets and clearly see the nature of the Buddha?

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: ” The Bhagavān replied, “Son of noble family,

original: 'jig rten gyi tshul khrims ni yongs su dag pa zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tshul khrims ni yongs su dag pa zhes mi bya'o //
translated: the conduct of the world is not called pure.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'jig rten gyi tshul khrims ni srid pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tshul khrims ni srid pa dang bcas pa /
translated: The morality of the world is not expansive,

original: rang bzhin gyis ma nges pa /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ma nges pa /
translated: not definite by nature,

original: mthar phyin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mthar phyin pa ma yin te /
translated: and not ultimate,

original: sems can thams cad kyi don du rgyas par 'gyur pa ma yin pa'i phyir yongs su dag pa zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don du rgyas par 'gyur pa ma yin pa'i phyir yongs su dag pa zhes mi bya'o //
translated: because it is not expansive for the sake of all sentient beings. Therefore, it is not called “pure.”

original: yongs su dag pa ma yin pas na 'gyod pa'i sems dang bcas so //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa ma yin pas na 'gyod pa'i sems dang bcas so //
translated: Since it is not pure, it is accompanied by regret.

original: 'gyod pa'i sems dang bcas pas na dga' ba'i sems med @420a *//🔽do; ;dga' ba med pas tshim pa med /🔽tshim pa med pas bde ba med do //
analyzed: 'gyod pa'i sems dang bcas pas na dga' ba'i sems med @420a *// do; ;dga' ba med pas tshim pa med / tshim pa med pas bde ba med do //
translated: Since it is accompanied by regret, it is not a joyful mind.🔽Since it is not joyful, it is not satisfied.🔽Since it is not satisfied, it is not blissful.

original: bde ba med pas mi g-yo ba'i ting nge 'dzin med do //
analyzed: bde ba med pas mi g-yo ba'i ting nge 'dzin med do //
translated: Since it is not blissful, it is not unshakable concentration.

original: mi g-yo ba'i ting nge 'dzin med pas shes pa dang / lta ba yang dag pa med do //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i ting nge 'dzin med pas shes pa dang / lta ba yang dag pa med do //
translated: Since it is not unshakable concentration, there is no right knowledge and view.

original: shes pa dang / lta ba yang dag pa med pas 'khor ba la skyo ba med /
analyzed: shes pa dang / lta ba yang dag pa med pas 'khor ba la skyo ba med /
translated: Since there is no right knowledge and view, there is no weariness with saṃsāra.

original: 'khor ba la skyo ba med pas rnam par grol bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: 'khor ba la skyo ba med pas rnam par grol bar mi 'gyur /
translated: Since there is no weariness with saṃsāra, there is no liberation.

original: rnam par ma grol bas na sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: rnam par ma grol bas na sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin mi mthong ngo //
translated: Since they are not liberated, they do not see the buddha-nature.

original: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin mi mthong bas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po mi mthong ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin mi mthong bas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po mi mthong ste /
translated: Since they do not see the buddha-nature, they do not see great parinirvāṇa.

original: de ni 'jig rten gyi tshul khrims zhes bya'i /
analyzed: de ni 'jig rten gyi tshul khrims zhes bya'i /
translated: This is called worldly morality,

original: yongs su dag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa ma yin no //
translated: but it is not pure.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yongs su dag pa'i tshul khrims ni tshul khrims nyid kyang tshul khrims ma yin pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i yongs su dag pa'i tshul khrims ni tshul khrims nyid kyang tshul khrims ma yin pa /
translated: the bodhisattva-mahāsattva’s pure morality is not morality itself,

original: srid pa dang bcas pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: srid pa dang bcas pa ma yin pa /
translated: it is not associated with existence,

original: nges pa / mthar phyin pa /
analyzed: nges pa / mthar phyin pa /
translated: it is definite, it is ultimate,

original: sems can gyi don du 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi don du 'gyur ba ste /
translated: and it benefits sentient beings.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims yongs su dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims yongs su dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the bodhisattva’s pure morality.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos yongs su dag pa'i tshul khrims la 'gyod pa med pa'i sems ched du ma bskyed kyang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos yongs su dag pa'i tshul khrims la 'gyod pa med pa'i sems ched du ma bskyed kyang /
translated: even though the bodhisattva-mahāsattva does not deliberately generate a regretful mind towards pure morality,

original: 'gyod pa med pa'i sems rang skye'o //
analyzed: 'gyod pa med pa'i sems rang skye'o //
translated: The mind of no regret arises by itself.

original: rigs kyi bu /🔽dper na / mi zhig me long thog na bzhin ched du snang bar ma byas kyang bzhin rang 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu / dper na / mi zhig me long thog na bzhin ched du snang bar ma byas kyang bzhin rang 'byung ngo //
translated: Good son,

original: @420b dper na /
analyzed: @420b dper na /
translated: it is like a man who, although he does not deliberately seek to see his own face in a mirror, sees it there.🔽Good son,

original: zhing pas zhing gshin pa las bon btab na myu gu ched du ma bskyed kyang myu gu rang skye'o //
analyzed: zhing pas zhing gshin pa las bon btab na myu gu ched du ma bskyed kyang myu gu rang skye'o //
translated: it is like a farmer who, having planted seeds in a good field, does not deliberately seek to make the sprouts grow, yet the sprouts grow by themselves.

original: dper na / me mar btsun na mun pa ched du med par ma byas kyang mun pa rang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na / me mar btsun na mun pa ched du med par ma byas kyang mun pa rang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is like a lamp that, although it does not deliberately seek to dispel darkness, dispels the darkness by itself.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Good son,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshul khrims yongs su dag par bsrungs pas 'gyod pa med pa'i sems rang skye ba'ang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshul khrims yongs su dag par bsrungs pas 'gyod pa med pa'i sems rang skye ba'ang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: it is the same with the bodhisattva-mahasattva who, by keeping the precepts pure, gives rise to the mind of no regret.

original: tshul khrims yongs su dag pas rab tu dga' ba'i sems thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims yongs su dag pas rab tu dga' ba'i sems thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: By keeping the precepts pure, he attains the mind of joy.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Good son,

original: dper na / skyes bu ngo bzhin bzang po dang ldan pa zhig bdag gi bzhin mthong na rab tu dga' ba'i sems skye'o //
analyzed: dper na / skyes bu ngo bzhin bzang po dang ldan pa zhig bdag gi bzhin mthong na rab tu dga' ba'i sems skye'o //
translated: it is like a man who, having a handsome face, is filled with joy when he sees his own face.

original: tshul khrims yongs su dag pa'ang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims yongs su dag pa'ang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The purity of morality is also like this.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Good son,

original: tshul khrims ngan pa can ni tshul khrims yongs su ma dag pas na dga' ba'i sems mi skye'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims ngan pa can ni tshul khrims yongs su ma dag pas na dga' ba'i sems mi skye'o //
translated: one who has broken the precepts and whose morality is impure will not be happy.

original: dper na / bzhin mi sdug pa zhig bdag gi bzhin mthong na dga' ba'i sems mi skye ba ltar tshul khrims ngan pa can yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na / bzhin mi sdug pa zhig bdag gi bzhin mthong na dga' ba'i sems mi skye ba ltar tshul khrims ngan pa can yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: For example, if an ugly person sees his own face, he will not be happy. One who has broken the precepts is also like this.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Good son,

original: dper na / bud med rdzi'u thogs pa gnyis shig gcig ni zho'i bum pa thogs la /🔽gcig ni dar ba'i bum pa thogs te /
analyzed: dper na / bud med rdzi'u thogs pa gnyis shig gcig ni zho'i bum pa thogs la / gcig ni dar ba'i bum pa thogs te /
translated: it is like two women carrying jars of milk and yogurt, respectively,🔽who are traveling together to the market.

original: gnyis ka 'grogs nas tshong 'dus su chas pa las lam du rdeg 'chos te /🔽bum pa gnyis ka chag na gcig ni dga'/
analyzed: gnyis ka 'grogs nas tshong 'dus su chas pa las lam du rdeg 'chos te / bum pa gnyis ka chag na gcig ni dga'/
translated: On the way they are attacked and the jars break.

original: gcig ni mi dga'o //
analyzed: gcig ni mi dga'o //
translated: One is happy and the other is not.

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang / tshul khrims nyams pa'ang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang / tshul khrims nyams pa'ang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Those who have morality and those who have broken the precepts are also like this.

original: tshul @421a *// khrims yongs su dag pa ni sems rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul @421a *// khrims yongs su dag pa ni sems rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Those whose morality is pure will be happy.

original: sems rab tu dga' bas na de 'di snyam du sems so //
analyzed: sems rab tu dga' bas na de 'di snyam du sems so //
translated: Because the mind is extremely joyful, he thinks like this:

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa las gang gis tshul khrims yongs su dag par bsrungs na mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa las gang gis tshul khrims yongs su dag par bsrungs na mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs te /
translated: “The Buddha, the World-Honored One, has said that those who leave the world and keep the precepts purely will attain nirvana.

original: bdag gis kyang tshul khrims yongs su dag par nan tan byas na thob par 'gyur snyam sems te /
analyzed: bdag gis kyang tshul khrims yongs su dag par nan tan byas na thob par 'gyur snyam sems te /
translated: If I leave the world and practice the precepts purely, I will attain it too.”

original: de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis na sems rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu de'i rkyen gyis na sems rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: For this reason, the mind is extremely joyful.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis yang gsol pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis yang gsol pa /
translated: Kāśyapa then asked,

original: bcom ldan 'das dga' ba dang / bde ba zhes bgyi ba la khyad par ci mchis /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dga' ba dang / bde ba zhes bgyi ba la khyad par ci mchis /
translated: “World-Honored One, what is the difference between joy and happiness?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Buddha replied,

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Good son,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kha na ma tho par 'gyur ba'i sdig pa mi byed pas na dga' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po kha na ma tho par 'gyur ba'i sdig pa mi byed pas na dga' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: because the bodhisattva-mahāsattva does not commit offenses that would lead to downfall, it is called joy.

original: yongs su dga' ba'i sems kyis tshul khrims srung ba ni bde ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su dga' ba'i sems kyis tshul khrims srung ba ni bde ba zhes bya'o //
translated: To observe the precepts with a joyful mind is called happiness.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Good son,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'khor ba shin tu rtogs pas dga' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'khor ba shin tu rtogs pas dga' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: because the bodhisattva mahasattva fully understands samsara, it is called joy.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po thob pas bde ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po thob pas bde ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Because he attains great nirvana, it is called happiness.

original: tha ma ni dga' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tha ma ni dga' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The inferior is called joy.

original: mchog ni bde ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mchog ni bde ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The superior is called happiness.

original: 'jig rten dang 'dres pa'i chos yongs su spangs pa ni dga' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'dres pa'i chos yongs su spangs pa ni dga' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Abandoning the Dharma mixed with the world is called joy.

original: @421b ma 'dres pa'i chos thob pa ni bde ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: @421b ma 'dres pa'i chos thob pa ni bde ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Attaining the unmixed Dharma is called happiness.

original: tshul khrims yongs su dag pas na lus las su rung ba dang / ngag rtsub po'i skyon med de /
analyzed: tshul khrims yongs su dag pas na lus las su rung ba dang / ngag rtsub po'i skyon med de /
translated: Because of the purity of morality, the body becomes serviceable and the fault of harsh speech is eliminated.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de'i cho lta ba dang / nyan pa dang / snom pa dang / ro myong bar byed pa dang / reg bya dang / shes par byed pa thams cad la kha na ma tho bar 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de'i cho lta ba dang / nyan pa dang / snom pa dang / ro myong bar byed pa dang / reg bya dang / shes par byed pa thams cad la kha na ma tho bar 'gyur ba med do //
translated: All the bodhisattvas’ seeing, hearing, smelling, tasting, touching, and knowing are free of wrongdoing.

original: kha na ma tho bar 'gyur ba med pas sems rab tu bde bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kha na ma tho bar 'gyur ba med pas sems rab tu bde bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because they are free of wrongdoing, their minds are at ease.

original: sems rab tu bde bar gyur pas na zhi ba'i ting nge 'dzin thob bo //
analyzed: sems rab tu bde bar gyur pas na zhi ba'i ting nge 'dzin thob bo //
translated: Because their minds are at ease, they attain the samādhi of tranquility.

original: zhi ba'i ting nge 'dzin thob pas na shes pa dang / lta ba yang dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhi ba'i ting nge 'dzin thob pas na shes pa dang / lta ba yang dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because they attain the samādhi of tranquility, their knowledge and views become correct.

original: shes pa dang / lta ba yang dag par gyur pas 'khor ba la yongs su skyo'o //
analyzed: shes pa dang / lta ba yang dag par gyur pas 'khor ba la yongs su skyo'o //
translated: Because their knowledge and views become correct, they become weary of saṃsāra.

original: 'khor ba la yongs su skyo bas na rnam par grol bar 'gyur /🔽rnam par grol bas na sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'khor ba la yongs su skyo bas na rnam par grol bar 'gyur / rnam par grol bas na sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin mthong ngo //
translated: Because they become weary of saṃsāra, they become liberated.🔽Because they become liberated, they see the nature of the Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin mthong bas na yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po thob bo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi rang bzhin mthong bas na yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po thob bo //
translated: Because they see the nature of the Buddha, they attain great parinirvāṇa.

original: de dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims yongs su dag pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims yongs su dag pa yin gyi /
translated: These are the bodhisattva’s pure moral discipline,

original: 'jig rten gyi tshul khrims ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tshul khrims ni ma yin no //
translated: not the moral discipline of the world.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Noble son,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos tshul khrims yongs su dag par bsrungs na chos rnam pa 'di lnga grogs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos tshul khrims yongs su dag par bsrungs na chos rnam pa 'di lnga grogs su 'gyur ro //
translated: when bodhisattva great beings guard their moral discipline purely, five qualities become their allies.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: dad pa dang / ldan pa yin /🔽khrel dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: dad pa dang / ldan pa yin / khrel dang ldan pa yin /
translated: They are having faith,🔽having a sense of shame,

original: 'dzem pa dang / ldan pa yin /
analyzed: 'dzem pa dang / ldan pa yin /
translated: having scruples,

original: @422a *// dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: @422a *// dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang ldan pa yin /
translated: having a spiritual friend,

original: tshul khrims la gus par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims la gus par byed pa yin no //
translated: and having respect for moral discipline.

original: sgrib pa lnga yongs su spangs pas lta ba rnam par dag par 'gyur ba dang / lta ba lnga yongs su spangs pas the tshom gyi sems med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgrib pa lnga yongs su spangs pas lta ba rnam par dag par 'gyur ba dang / lta ba lnga yongs su spangs pas the tshom gyi sems med par 'gyur ro //
translated: By abandoning the five hindrances, their view becomes pure, and by abandoning the five views, they have no doubts.

original: gzhan yang the tshom lnga yongs su spong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang the tshom lnga yongs su spong bar 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, they abandon five kinds of doubt.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: sangs rgyas la the tshom za ba dang / chos la the tshom za ba dang / dge 'dun la the tshom za ba dang / tshul khrims la the tshom za ba dang / bag med pa la the tshom za ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la the tshom za ba dang / chos la the tshom za ba dang / dge 'dun la the tshom za ba dang / tshul khrims la the tshom za ba dang / bag med pa la the tshom za ba'o //
translated: They are: doubt about the Buddha, doubt about the Dharma, doubt about the Saṅgha, doubt about morality, and doubt about the Tathāgata’s teachings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de'i tshe dbang po lnga'ang thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de'i tshe dbang po lnga'ang thob par 'gyur te /
translated: At that time, the bodhisattva also attains the five faculties.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: dad pa'i dbang po dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po dang / dran pa'i dbang po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po dang / shes rab kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: dad pa'i dbang po dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po dang / dran pa'i dbang po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po dang / shes rab kyi dbang po'o //
translated: They are the faculty of faith, the faculty of perseverance, the faculty of mindfulness, the faculty of concentration, and the faculty of wisdom.

original: dbang po lnga thob pas mya ngan las 'das pa rnam pa lnga'ang thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbang po lnga thob pas mya ngan las 'das pa rnam pa lnga'ang thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: By attaining the five faculties, he also attains the five kinds of nirvāṇa.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: gzugs rnam par grol ba nas /
analyzed: gzugs rnam par grol ba nas /
translated: They are the liberation of form,

original: rnam par shes pa rnam par grol ba'i bar du ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rnam par grol ba'i bar du ste /
translated: up to the liberation of consciousness.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims yongs su dag pa zhes bya'i /
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims yongs su dag pa zhes bya'i /
translated: This is called the bodhisattva’s pure morality,

original: 'jig rten gyi ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi ma yin no //
translated: not that of the world.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: de dag ni 'jig rten pas mi shes pa dang / mi mthong ba dang / mi rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: de dag ni 'jig rten pas mi shes pa dang / mi mthong ba dang / mi rtogs pa ste /
translated: These are not known, not seen, and not realized by worldly people.

original: byang chub sems dpas shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas shes pa dang / mthong ba dang / rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called known, seen, and realized by bodhisattvas.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: ji ste nga'i nye gnas las @422b theg pa chen po yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i mdo sde 'chang ngam /
analyzed: ji ste nga'i nye gnas las @422b theg pa chen po yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i mdo sde 'chang ngam /
translated: if someone who is my disciple upholds,

original: 'dzin tam / klog gam /
analyzed: 'dzin tam / klog gam /
translated: recites,

original: 'dom tam / glegs bam du 'dri'am /
analyzed: 'dom tam / glegs bam du 'dri'am /
translated: copies in book form,

original: ston cing 'chad pa gang zhig tshul khrims nyams na gzhan gyis brnyas shing smod de /
analyzed: ston cing 'chad pa gang zhig tshul khrims nyams na gzhan gyis brnyas shing smod de /
translated: teaches, and explains the Mahāyāna Great Parinirvāṇa Sūtra, but if their precepts are impaired, they will be despised and criticized by others.

original: de dag 'di skad du gal te sangs rgyas kyis dgongs pa'i snying po yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo mthu dang ldan pa zhig yin na /
analyzed: de dag 'di skad du gal te sangs rgyas kyis dgongs pa'i snying po yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo mthu dang ldan pa zhig yin na /
translated: They will say, 'If the Mahāparinirvāṇa Sūtra, the Buddha's intention, were powerful,

original: ci'i phyir tshul khrims mnos pa nyams par 'gyur zhes zer ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir tshul khrims mnos pa nyams par 'gyur zhes zer ro //
translated: why would the precepts they have taken be impaired?'

original: ci ste gang zhig mya ngan 'das pa'i mdo 'chang ngam /
analyzed: ci ste gang zhig mya ngan 'das pa'i mdo 'chang ngam /
translated: If someone upholds the Mahāparinirvāṇa Sūtra,

original: 'dzin pa la tshul khrims nyams na de ni mdo sde mthu med par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dzin pa la tshul khrims nyams na de ni mdo sde mthu med par rig par bya ste /
translated: If one’s moral discipline is impaired, one should know that the power of the sūtras is ineffective.

original: gal te mthu med na klog gam 'don kyang phan pa'i don du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te mthu med na klog gam 'don kyang phan pa'i don du mi 'gyur te /
translated: If they are ineffective, then even if one recites or chants them, it will not be of benefit.

original: de ltar mya ngan las 'das pa'i mdo sde la brnyas smad pas sems can tshad med mtha' yas pa snyed sems can dmyal bar ltung bar byed do //
analyzed: de ltar mya ngan las 'das pa'i mdo sde la brnyas smad pas sems can tshad med mtha' yas pa snyed sems can dmyal bar ltung bar byed do //
translated: In this way, by disparaging the sūtras of nirvāṇa, one causes countless, limitless sentient beings to fall into the hells.

original: ci ste mdo sde 'di nyid 'chang ngam 'dzin pa de tshul khrims nyams par byed na de ni sems can gyi sdig pa'i bshes gnyen yin te /
analyzed: ci ste mdo sde 'di nyid 'chang ngam 'dzin pa de tshul khrims nyams par byed na de ni sems can gyi sdig pa'i bshes gnyen yin te /
translated: If one who upholds or holds this very sūtra impairs moral discipline, then one is a sinful friend of sentient beings.

original: nga'i nye gnas ma yin gyi /
analyzed: nga'i nye gnas ma yin gyi /
translated: One is not my disciple,

original: bdud kyi 'khor yin no //🔽gang zag de ni mdo sde 'di nyid 'chang ngam /
analyzed: bdud kyi 'khor yin no // gang zag de ni mdo sde 'di nyid 'chang ngam /
translated: but rather an entourage of Māra.🔽That person is not permitted to uphold or hold this very sūtra,

original: 'dzin tam / nyan du'ang ma gnang gi /🔽gnyis na ma bcangs /
analyzed: 'dzin tam / nyan du'ang ma gnang gi / gnyis na ma bcangs /
translated: or even to listen to it.🔽It is better not to uphold it,

original: ma bzung / ma bsgoms kyang bla'i /🔽tshul khrims nyams pas 'chang ngam /
analyzed: ma bzung / ma bsgoms kyang bla'i / tshul khrims nyams pas 'chang ngam /
translated: not to hold it, and not to meditate on it.

original: 'dzin tam / sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dzin tam / sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not to be upheld, held, or practiced by one whose moral discipline is impaired.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: nga'i nye gnas las @423a *//🔽yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i mdo sde 'chang ngam /🔽'dzin tam / klog gam /
analyzed: nga'i nye gnas las @423a *// yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i mdo sde 'chang ngam / 'dzin tam / klog gam /
translated: If my disciples🔽possess, uphold, read, recite, copy,

original: 'don tam / glegs bam du 'dri ba'am /
analyzed: 'don tam / glegs bam du 'dri ba'am /
translated: or wish to teach and uphold the Mahāparinirvāṇa-sūtra,

original: ston cing 'chang 'dod na yang dag pa'i lus dang sems kyis bsgrub par bya'i /
analyzed: ston cing 'chang 'dod na yang dag pa'i lus dang sems kyis bsgrub par bya'i /
translated: they should practice with a correct body and mind,

original: nyam rangs dang / 'phyar ba dang / 'gran tor gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyam rangs dang / 'phyar ba dang / 'gran tor gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: not with a frivolous, arrogant, or competitive mind.

original: de la lus las byung ba ni nyam rangs zhes bya /🔽sems las byung ba ni 'phyar ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la lus las byung ba ni nyam rangs zhes bya / sems las byung ba ni 'phyar ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Among them, that which arises from the body is called frivolous,🔽and that which arises from the mind is called arrogant.

original: tshol ba dang bcas pa'i sems ni 'phyar ba zhes bya /
analyzed: tshol ba dang bcas pa'i sems ni 'phyar ba zhes bya /
translated: A mind that seeks is called arrogant,

original: lus kyi las byas pa ni nyam rangs zhes bya'o //🔽ci ste nga'i nye gnas tshol ba dang bcas; byed pa'i las dang bcas na theg pa chen po yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i mdo sde 'di 'chang ngam /
analyzed: lus kyi las byas pa ni nyam rangs zhes bya'o // ci ste nga'i nye gnas tshol ba dang bcas; byed pa'i las dang bcas na theg pa chen po yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i mdo sde 'di 'chang ngam /
translated: and physical actions are called frivolous.🔽If my disciples seek,

original: bzung bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: bzung bar mi bya'o //
translated: and if their actions are frivolous, they should not possess or uphold this Mahāparinirvāṇa-sūtra of the Great Vehicle.

original: ci ste de lta bu dang bcas pas mdo sde 'di nyid 'chang ngam 'dzin par byed na /
analyzed: ci ste de lta bu dang bcas pas mdo sde 'di nyid 'chang ngam 'dzin par byed na /
translated: If someone were to possess and uphold this very sūtra,

original: gzhan gyis brnyas smad par 'gyur te /

original: rigs pa ni shes pa'o //
analyzed: rigs pa ni shes pa'o //

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni phung po lnga la shin tu mkhas pas 'jig rten rig pa zhes bya'o //

analyzed: gzhan yang 'jig rten zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa lnga'o //

original: rig pa zhes bya ba ni ma chags pa'o //
analyzed: rig pa zhes bya ba ni ma chags pa'o //

original: 'dod pa lnga la yongs su ma chags pa'i phyir yang 'jig rten rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa lnga la yongs su ma chags pa'i phyir yang 'jig rten rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because he is not at all attached to the five desires, he is also called “one who knows the world. ”

original: gzhan yang 'jig rten zhes bya ba ni shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med grangs med de /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'jig rten zhes bya ba ni shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med grangs med de /
translated: Furthermore, the world is the immeasurable and innumerable world systems in the eastern direction.

original: de bzhin du lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / phyogs mtshams bzhi dang / steng dang / 'og gi 'jig rten gyi khams kyang de bzhin du rig pas na /
analyzed: de bzhin du lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / phyogs mtshams bzhi dang / steng dang / 'og gi 'jig rten gyi khams kyang de bzhin du rig pas na /
translated: Similarly, the world systems in the south, west, north, four intermediate directions, above, and below are also known in the same way.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni 'jig rten rig pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni 'jig rten rig pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the Bhagavān Buddha is the knower of the world.

original: sdig pa'i rgyu dang / 'bras bu shes pa ste /
analyzed: sdig pa'i rgyu dang / 'bras bu shes pa ste /

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi shes pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi shes pa ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not the knowledge of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: sangs rgyas nyag gcig gis mkhyen pas na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni 'jig rten rig pa'o /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyag gcig gis mkhyen pas na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni 'jig rten rig pa'o /
translated: The Buddha alone knows this, and so the Bhagavat Buddha is called the knower of the world.

original: gzhan yang 'jig rten zhes bya ba ni padmo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'jig rten zhes bya ba ni padmo zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, the word “world” means “lotus.”

original: rigs pa ni mi gos pa zhes te /
analyzed: rigs pa ni mi gos pa zhes te /
translated: “Reason” means “unstained.”

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: de ni 'jig rten gyi don to //
analyzed: de ni 'jig rten gyi don to //
translated: this is the meaning of “world.”

original: padmo zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: padmo zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: “Lotus” means “tathāgata.”

original: mi gos pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad kyis mi gos pa'i phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni 'jig rten rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi gos pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa la 'jig rten gyi chos brgyad kyis mi gos pa'i phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni 'jig rten rig pa zhes bya'o //

original: gzhan yang 'jig rten rig pa ni sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' la 'jig rten rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'jig rten rig pa ni sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' la 'jig rten rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, the knower of the world is the Buddha and the bodhisattvas.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' ni 'jig rten gzigs pa'i phyir 'jig rten rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' ni 'jig rten gzigs pa'i phyir 'jig rten rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The Buddha and the bodhisattvas are called the knowers of the world because they see the world.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: dper na / zas kyi rkyen gyis 'tsho bar 'gyur bas zas la 'tsho ba zhes bya ba dang 'dra bar sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' yang 'jig rten gzigs pas 'jig rten rig pa zhes bya'o //

translated: For example, because one lives by the condition of food, food is called “living.” In the same way, because the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas see the world, they are called “world-knowers.”

original: de la ji ltar na lba na med pa zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na lba na med pa zhe na /

original: bla na yod pa ni gcod pa'i don te /
analyzed: bla na yod pa ni gcod pa'i don te /

original: gcad du med pa'i phyir bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: gcad du med pa'i phyir bla na med pa'o //

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la nyon mongs pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir gcad du med de /

original: de bas na sangs rgyas bcom @429b ldan 'das ni bla na med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na sangs rgyas bcom @429b ldan 'das ni bla na med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, are called “unsurpassed.”

original: gzhan yang bla na med pa zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang bla na med pa zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa dang bcas pa'o //

analyzed: bla na med pa ni rtsod pa med pa ste /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la rtsod pa med pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni bla na med pa'o //

analyzed: gzhan yang bla na yod pa zhes bya ba ni tshig gis sun dbyung du rung ba'o //

original: bla na med pa ni tshig gis sun dbyung du mi rung ba ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa ni tshig gis sun dbyung du mi rung ba ste /
translated: The “superior” is that which cannot be refuted by words.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa la sems can thams cad kyis sun dbyung du mi rung bas na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa la sems can thams cad kyis sun dbyung du mi rung bas na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni bla na med pa'o //
translated: Since the Tathāgata’s teachings cannot be refuted by any sentient being, the Bhagavān Buddha is superior.

original: gzhan yang bla na yod pa zhes bya ba ni bla na yod pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang bla na yod pa zhes bya ba ni bla na yod pa'o //

original: bla na med pa zhes bya ba ni bla na med pa ste /

analyzed: dus gsum gyi sangs rgyas rnams la 'das pa med pa'i phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni bla na med pa'o //

original: gzhan yang bla na yod pa zhes bya ba ni gsar rnying ngo //
analyzed: gzhan yang bla na yod pa zhes bya ba ni gsar rnying ngo //
translated: Moreover, the “inferior” is that which is new and old.

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i ngo bo nyid du gyur pas gsar rnying zhes bya ba med de /

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni bla na med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni bla na med pa zhes bya'o //

analyzed: gang zhe na /

translated: For example, it is like a charioteer who can be led as one wishes by touching the hair, skin, flesh, bones, and so on.

original: rigs kyi bu /

analyzed: rta'i kha lo sgyur ba ni nges pa ma yin gyi /

analyzed: lus mi dge ba'i las yongs su spang @431a *//

original: bar bya'o // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: bar bya'o // de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: de bas na sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' ni rtag tu chos 'di nyid sems can rnams la ston te /

analyzed: ngag dang / yid kyang de bzhin du rig par bya'o; ;de bas na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni bla na med pa ston pa'o //

original: gzhan yang sngon ma thob pa thob par gyur la /
analyzed: gzhan yang sngon ma thob pa thob par gyur la /
translated: Moreover, they cause the attainment of what has not been attained before.

original: thob pa rnams sems can la ston pa dang / thog ma nas tshangs par ma spyad pa tshangs par spyod de /
analyzed: thob pa rnams sems can la ston pa dang / thog ma nas tshangs par ma spyad pa tshangs par spyod de /
translated: They teach sentient beings what has been attained. They cause those who have not previously practiced pure conduct to practice pure conduct.

original: spyod pa rnams kyang sems can la ston pa dang / bdag nyid ma rig pa bcom pas sems can gyi ma rig pa 'joms pa dang / bdag nyid yongs su dag pa'i mig thob pas sems can gyi ldongs pa'i rab rib bsal nas yongs su dag pa'i mig thob par byed pa dang /
analyzed: spyod pa rnams kyang sems can la ston pa dang / bdag nyid ma rig pa bcom pas sems can gyi ma rig pa 'joms pa dang / bdag nyid yongs su dag pa'i mig thob pas sems can gyi ldongs pa'i rab rib bsal nas yongs su dag pa'i mig thob par byed pa dang /
translated: They teach sentient beings who practice pure conduct. They destroy the ignorance of sentient beings by destroying their own ignorance. They cause sentient beings to attain the purified eye by removing the cataracts of sentient beings’ blindness through attaining the purified eye themselves.

original: bdag nyid bden pa @431b gnyis shes pas sems can rnams la'ang bden pa gnyis ston pa dang / bdag nyid rnam par grol bas sems can rnams la rnam par grol ba'i chos ston pa dang / bdag nyid mtha' med pa'i 'khor ba'i klung las brgal bas sems can thams cad kyang de la sgrol ba dang /
analyzed: bdag nyid bden pa @431b gnyis shes pas sems can rnams la'ang bden pa gnyis ston pa dang / bdag nyid rnam par grol bas sems can rnams la rnam par grol ba'i chos ston pa dang / bdag nyid mtha' med pa'i 'khor ba'i klung las brgal bas sems can thams cad kyang de la sgrol ba dang /
translated: Because I have crossed the river of cyclic existence, which is without end, I ferry all sentient beings across it.🔽Because I am fearless, I teach fearlessness to sentient beings.

original: bdag nyid 'jigs pa med par gyur bas sems can rnams la 'jigs pa med pa ston pa dang / bdag nyid yongs su mya ngan las 'das pas sems can rnams la mya ngan las 'das pa chen po ston pa ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid 'jigs pa med par gyur bas sems can rnams la 'jigs pa med pa ston pa dang / bdag nyid yongs su mya ngan las 'das pas sems can rnams la mya ngan las 'das pa chen po ston pa ste /
translated: Because I am completely liberated, I teach great liberation to sentient beings.

original: de'i phyir na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni bla na med pa ston pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni bla na med pa ston pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the Blessed Buddha is called the unsurpassed teacher.

original: lha zhes bya ba ni nyin mo zhes bya ste /
analyzed: lha zhes bya ba ni nyin mo zhes bya ste /
translated: “‘God’ means ‘day.’

original: lha rnams la nyin ring mtshan thung bas ni lha zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lha rnams la nyin ring mtshan thung bas ni lha zhes bya'o //
translated: Because the gods have long days and short nights, they are called ‘gods.’

original: gzhan yang lha zhes bya ba ni mya ngan med pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang lha zhes bya ba ni mya ngan med pa ste /
translated: Moreover, ‘god’ means ‘without sorrow.’

original: rtag tu bde ba'i phyir na lha zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtag tu bde ba'i phyir na lha zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called ‘god.’

original: gzhan yang lha zhes bya ba ni snang ba'i sgron ma zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang lha zhes bya ba ni snang ba'i sgron ma zhes bya'o //
translated: “Moreover, god is called ‘the lamp of illumination.’

original: mun pa bcom nas snang ba chen por 'gyur ba'i phyir lha zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mun pa bcom nas snang ba chen por 'gyur ba'i phyir lha zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it destroys darkness and becomes a great light, it is called ‘god.’

original: gzhan yang sdig pa'i las nag po bcom nas dge ba'i las dkar po thob ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang sdig pa'i las nag po bcom nas dge ba'i las dkar po thob ste /
translated: “Moreover, having destroyed black, evil karma, one obtains white, good karma.

original: lhar skye ba'i phyir na lha zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lhar skye ba'i phyir na lha zhes bya'o //
translated: Because one is born as a god, it is called ‘god.’

original: lha ni bkra shis pa ste /
analyzed: lha ni bkra shis pa ste /
translated: “God is auspicious.

original: bkra shis pa'i phyir lha zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bkra shis pa'i phyir lha zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it is auspicious, it is called ‘god.’

original: gzhan yang lha zhes bya ba ni nyi ma ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang lha zhes bya ba ni nyi ma ste /
translated: “Moreover, god is the sun.

original: nyi ma la 'od yod pa'i phyir nyi ma la lha zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyi ma la 'od yod pa'i phyir nyi ma la lha zhes bya'o //
translated: Because the sun has light, the sun is called ‘god.’

original: don de lta bas na lha zhes bya'o //
analyzed: don de lta bas na lha zhes bya'o //
translated: Because of this meaning, it is called ‘god.’

original: mi zhes bya ba ni don la mang du sems pa'o //
analyzed: mi zhes bya ba ni don la mang du sems pa'o //
translated: “Human means to think a lot about the meaning.

original: gzhan yang mi zhes @432a *//
analyzed: gzhan yang mi zhes @432a *//
translated: Moreover, human

original: bya ba ni lus dang / ngag 'jam zhing des pa'o //🔽gzhan yang mi zhes bya ba ni nga rgyal dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba ni lus dang / ngag 'jam zhing des pa'o // gzhan yang mi zhes bya ba ni nga rgyal dang bcas pa'o //
translated: means a body and speech that are gentle and kind.🔽Moreover, human means to have pride.

original: mi zhes bya ba ni nga rgyal bcom pa'o //
analyzed: mi zhes bya ba ni nga rgyal bcom pa'o //
translated: Human means to have destroyed pride.

original: rigs kyi bu sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni sems can thams cad kyi bla na med pa'i ston pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni sems can thams cad kyi bla na med pa'i ston pa yin mod kyi /
translated: Son of noble family, the Blessed Buddha is indeed the unsurpassed teacher of all sentient beings.

original: gsung rab las kyang lha dang mi'i ston pa zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gsung rab las kyang lha dang mi'i ston pa zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Yet in the scriptures, he is also called the teacher of gods and humans.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: sems can thams cad kyi nang na lha dang mi 'ba' zhig gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed nus shing /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi nang na lha dang mi 'ba' zhig gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed nus shing /
translated: Because only gods and humans among all sentient beings are able to generate the mind set on unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,

original: dge ba bcu'i las byed nus pas rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi 'bras bu dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur bas de'i phyir na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni lha dang mi'i ston pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba bcu'i las byed nus pas rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi 'bras bu dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur bas de'i phyir na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni lha dang mi'i ston pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and are able to perform the ten virtuous actions. Therefore, they are able to attain the fruit of stream enterer, the fruit of once-returner, the fruit of non-returner, the fruit of arhat, the fruit of pratyekabuddha, and unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening. For this reason, the Blessed Buddha is called the teacher of gods and humans.”

original: de la ji ltar na sangs rgyas bya she na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na sangs rgyas bya she na /
translated: How is it that one becomes a buddha?

original: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni tshor ba'i don te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni tshor ba'i don te /
translated: “Buddha” means to experience.

original: bdag kyang tshor la gzhan yang tshor bar byed do //
analyzed: bdag kyang tshor la gzhan yang tshor bar byed do //
translated: One experiences oneself and causes others to experience.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: dper na / mi zhig khyim du rkun po 'ong bar tshor na rkun pos mi tshugs so //
analyzed: dper na / mi zhig khyim du rkun po 'ong bar tshor na rkun pos mi tshugs so //
translated: For example, if a person experiences a thief coming into his house, the thief cannot harm him.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang tshad med pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad tshor te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'ang tshad med pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad tshor te /
translated: The bodhisattva-mahāsattva experiences all immeasurable afflictions.

original: de ltar tshor bas na nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis mi @432b tshugs so //
analyzed: de ltar tshor bas na nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis mi @432b tshugs so //
translated: Since he experiences them in this way, he is not harmed by any afflictions.

original: de bas na sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, he is called a buddha.

original: de ltar tshor bas na mi skye /
analyzed: de ltar tshor bas na mi skye /
translated: Since he experiences in this way, he does not take birth,

original: mi rga / mi na /
analyzed: mi rga / mi na /
translated: does not age,🔽does not fall ill,

original: mi 'chi ste /
analyzed: mi 'chi ste /
translated: and does not die.

original: de'i phyir na sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir na sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, he is called a buddha.

original: de la ji ltar na bcom ldan 'das she na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na bcom ldan 'das she na /
translated: How is he the Bhagavān?

original: bcom pa zhes bya ba ni bcom pa'o //
analyzed: bcom pa zhes bya ba ni bcom pa'o //
translated: “Bhagavān” means “conquered.”

original: ldan pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: ldan pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: “Possesses” means “afflictions.”

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad bcom pa'i phyir na bcom ldan 'das zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad bcom pa'i phyir na bcom ldan 'das zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called the Bhagavat because he has destroyed all afflictions.

original: gzhan yang dge ba'i chos thams cad dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang dge ba'i chos thams cad dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, he is so called because he is endowed with all good qualities,

original: chos rnams kyi don la shin tu mkhas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi don la shin tu mkhas pa'i phyir /
translated: because he is well versed in the meaning of the Dharma,

original: yon tan chen po dang ldan pas gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yon tan chen po dang ldan pas gzhan gyis mi thub pa'i phyir /
translated: because he is invincible due to his great virtues,

original: grags pa chen po phyogs bcur grags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: grags pa chen po phyogs bcur grags pa'i phyir /
translated: because his great fame is renowned in the ten directions,

original: sbyin pa rnam pa sna tshogs byin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sbyin pa rnam pa sna tshogs byin pa'i phyir /
translated: because he has given various kinds of gifts,

original: bskal pa tshad med grangs med pa'i bar du bud med kyi dbang po skyugs pa lta bur bor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bskal pa tshad med grangs med pa'i bar du bud med kyi dbang po skyugs pa lta bur bor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and because for countless eons he has spat out the female faculty like vomit.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: gal te skyes pa'am bud med gang zhig gis de ltar sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa bsgoms na /
analyzed: gal te skyes pa'am bud med gang zhig gis de ltar sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa bsgoms na /
translated: if any man or woman meditates on the recollection of the Buddha in this way,

original: 'gro'am sdod dam /
analyzed: 'gro'am sdod dam /
translated: whether walking, standing,

original: 'dug gam nyal lam /
analyzed: 'dug gam nyal lam /
translated: sitting, lying down,

original: snang ngam mun par gyur kyang /
analyzed: snang ngam mun par gyur kyang /
translated: in light or darkness,

original: nyin mtshan rtag tu sangs rgyas mthong ba dang mi 'bral lo //
analyzed: nyin mtshan rtag tu sangs rgyas mthong ba dang mi 'bral lo //
translated: they will never be separated from the sight of the Buddha day and night.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: ci'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa nas bcom ldan 'das kyi bar du de lta bu yon tan tshad med pa dang / grags pa chen po dang ldan zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa nas bcom ldan 'das kyi bar du de lta bu yon tan tshad med pa dang / grags pa chen po dang ldan zhe na /
translated: Why is it that the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, up to the World-Honored Buddha, has such immeasurable virtues and great fame?

original: rigs kyi bu /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sngon bskal pa tshad med @433a *//
analyzed: rigs kyi bu / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sngon bskal pa tshad med @433a *//
translated: Good son!

original: grangs med pa'i bar du pha ma dang / mkhan po dang / slob dpon dang / bla ma dang / gong ma rnams la rim gro dang bkur stir byas /
analyzed: grangs med pa'i bar du pha ma dang / mkhan po dang / slob dpon dang / bla ma dang / gong ma rnams la rim gro dang bkur stir byas /
translated: In the past, for immeasurable, countless eons, the bodhisattva-mahasattva served his parents, teachers, elders, and those of high status with respect and reverence.

original: bskal pa tshad med pa'i bar du sems can gyi phyir sbyin pa byin pa dang / tshul khrims bsrungs pa dang / bzod pa bsgoms par byas pa dang / brtson 'grus brtsams pa dang / bsam gtan la mnyam par bzhag pa dang / shes rab la nan tan byas pa dang /
analyzed: bskal pa tshad med pa'i bar du sems can gyi phyir sbyin pa byin pa dang / tshul khrims bsrungs pa dang / bzod pa bsgoms par byas pa dang / brtson 'grus brtsams pa dang / bsam gtan la mnyam par bzhag pa dang / shes rab la nan tan byas pa dang /
translated: For immeasurable eons, he gave for the sake of sentient beings, guarded his precepts, cultivated patience, initiated effort, entered dhyana, and practiced wisdom.

original: byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / dga' ba chen po dang / btang snyoms chen po la nan tan byas pas de'i phyir mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu dang / rdo rje lta bu'i sku thob par gyur to //
analyzed: byams pa chen po dang / snying rje chen po dang / dga' ba chen po dang / btang snyoms chen po la nan tan byas pas de'i phyir mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu dang / rdo rje lta bu'i sku thob par gyur to //
translated: Because of his earnest practice of great love, great compassion, great joy, and great equanimity, he attained the body of a vajra and the thirty-two marks and eighty minor characteristics of a great person.

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sngon bskal pa tshad med grangs med pa'i bar du dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi dbang po la nan tan byas te /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sngon bskal pa tshad med grangs med pa'i bar du dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi dbang po la nan tan byas te /
translated: “Moreover, the bodhisattva earnestly practiced the faculties of faith, diligence, mindfulness, concentration, and wisdom for immeasurable, incalculable eons in the past.

original: slob dpon dang / bla ma la rim gro dang bkur stir byas nas de'ang chos 'dod pa'i phyir gyi /
analyzed: slob dpon dang / bla ma la rim gro dang bkur stir byas nas de'ang chos 'dod pa'i phyir gyi /
translated: He served and venerated teachers and gurus, and he did so for the sake of the Dharma.

original: zas dang rnyed pa 'dod pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: zas dang rnyed pa 'dod pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: He did not do so for the sake of food or wealth.

original: byang chub sems dpas gal te mdo sde bcu gnyis bzung nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas gal te mdo sde bcu gnyis bzung nas /
translated: If the bodhisattva had memorized the twelve divisions of the scriptures,

original: gal te klog gam 'don kyang rtag tu sems can thams cad rnam par grol bar bya ba dang / rab tu bde bar bya ba'i phyir gyi /
analyzed: gal te klog gam 'don kyang rtag tu sems can thams cad rnam par grol bar bya ba dang / rab tu bde bar bya ba'i phyir gyi /
translated: If he reads or recites, it is always for the sake of liberating all sentient beings and making them happy.

original: bdag nyid kyi phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not for his own sake.

original: @433b ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: @433b ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni rtag tu 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems dang / rab tu byung ba'i sems dang / 'dus ma byas pa'i sems dang / rtsod pa med pa'i sems dang / dri ma med pa'i sems dang / bcings pa med pa'i sems dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni rtag tu 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems dang / rab tu byung ba'i sems dang / 'dus ma byas pa'i sems dang / rtsod pa med pa'i sems dang / dri ma med pa'i sems dang / bcings pa med pa'i sems dang /
translated: The bodhisattva always has a mind that is beyond the world, a mind that is fully ordained, an unconditioned mind, a mind that is free of conflict, a mind that is stainless, a mind that is unfettered,

original: chags pa med pa'i sems dang / sgrib pa med pa'i sems dang / lung mi ston pa med pa'i sems dang / 'khor ba med pa'i sems dang / the tshom gyi dra ba med pa'i sems dang / 'dod chags med pa'i sems dang / zhe sdang med pa'i sems dang /
analyzed: chags pa med pa'i sems dang / sgrib pa med pa'i sems dang / lung mi ston pa med pa'i sems dang / 'khor ba med pa'i sems dang / the tshom gyi dra ba med pa'i sems dang / 'dod chags med pa'i sems dang / zhe sdang med pa'i sems dang /
translated: a mind that is unattached, a mind that is unobstructed, a mind that is not indeterminate, a mind that is not in saṃsāra, a mind that is free of the net of doubt, a mind that is free of desire, a mind that is free of anger,

original: gti mug med pa'i sems dang / nga rgyal med pa'i sems dang / rnyog pa med pa'i sems dang / nyon mongs pa med pa'i sems dang / sdug bsngal med pa'i sems dang / tshad med pa'i sems dang rgya che ba'i sems dang / nam mkha' lta bu'i sems dang /🔽med pa'i sems dang / med pa ma yin pa'i sems dang / dul ba'i sems dang / mi skyo ba'i sems dang / mi 'chab pa'i sems dang / 'jig rten ma yin pa'i sems dang / rtag tu ting nge 'dzin gyi sems dang / rtag tu nan tan byed pa'i sems dang /
analyzed: gti mug med pa'i sems dang / nga rgyal med pa'i sems dang / rnyog pa med pa'i sems dang / nyon mongs pa med pa'i sems dang / sdug bsngal med pa'i sems dang / tshad med pa'i sems dang rgya che ba'i sems dang / nam mkha' lta bu'i sems dang / med pa'i sems dang / med pa ma yin pa'i sems dang / dul ba'i sems dang / mi skyo ba'i sems dang / mi 'chab pa'i sems dang / 'jig rten ma yin pa'i sems dang / rtag tu ting nge 'dzin gyi sems dang / rtag tu nan tan byed pa'i sems dang /
translated: a mind free from delusion, a mind free from pride, a mind free from disturbance, a mind free from afflictions, a mind free from suffering, a mind of immeasurability, a mind of vastness, a mind like space,🔽a mind of non-existence, a mind of non-non-existence, a mind of discipline, a mind of non-exhaustion, a mind of non-concealment, a mind not of the world, a mind always in samādhi, a mind always engaged in practice,

original: rtag tu rnam par grol ba'i sems dang / re ba med pa'i sems dang / smon pa med pa'i sems dang / shin tu smon pa med pa'i sems dang / smra ba med pa'i sems dang / mnyen zhing des pa'i @434a *//
analyzed: rtag tu rnam par grol ba'i sems dang / re ba med pa'i sems dang / smon pa med pa'i sems dang / shin tu smon pa med pa'i sems dang / smra ba med pa'i sems dang / mnyen zhing des pa'i @434a *//
translated: a mind always liberated, a mind of no hope, a mind of no aspiration, a mind of complete non-aspiration, a mind of no speech, a mind of gentleness and patience,

original: sems dang / mi gnas pa'i sems dang / dbang sgyur ba'i sems dang / zag pa med pa'i sems dang / don dam pa'i sems dang / mi ldog pa'i sems dang / mi rtog pa'i sems dang / yang dag pa'i sems dang / g-yo sgyu med pa'i sems dang /
analyzed: sems dang / mi gnas pa'i sems dang / dbang sgyur ba'i sems dang / zag pa med pa'i sems dang / don dam pa'i sems dang / mi ldog pa'i sems dang / mi rtog pa'i sems dang / yang dag pa'i sems dang / g-yo sgyu med pa'i sems dang /
translated: the mind of non-abiding, the mind of mastery, the uncontaminated mind, the ultimate mind, the irreversible mind, the non-conceptual mind, the correct mind, the mind free of deceit and fraud,

original: dge ba'i sems dang / lhag chad med pa'i sems dang / bar chad med pa'i sems dang / bus pa lta bu ma yin pa'i sems dang / nyan thos lta bu ma yin pa'i sems dang / rang sangs rgyas lta bu ma yin pa'i sems dang /
analyzed: dge ba'i sems dang / lhag chad med pa'i sems dang / bar chad med pa'i sems dang / bus pa lta bu ma yin pa'i sems dang / nyan thos lta bu ma yin pa'i sems dang / rang sangs rgyas lta bu ma yin pa'i sems dang /
