analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shin tu brtags na sbyin pa de ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rgyu yin pas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams sbyin pa de la shin tu bsnyen te nan tan byed pas
translated: The bodhisattva-mahāsattva, having thoroughly examined, sees that generosity is the cause of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment. The buddhas and bodhisattvas have thoroughly approached and practiced generosity.

original: bdag kyang de la bsnyen te nan tan bya'o //
analyzed: bdag kyang de la bsnyen te nan tan bya'o //
translated: Therefore, I too should approach and practice it.

original: gal te sbyin pa ma byas na 'khor rnam bzhi'i rgyan du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te sbyin pa ma byas na 'khor rnam bzhi'i rgyan du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If I do not practice generosity, I will not be an ornament for the fourfold assembly.

original: sbyin pa byas pas kun nas nyon mongs pa yongs su ma chod kyang da ltar gyi nyon mongs pa 'joms par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa byas pas kun nas nyon mongs pa yongs su ma chod kyang da ltar gyi nyon mongs pa 'joms par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if I do not completely sever afflictions through generosity, I will be able to conquer present afflictions.

original: sbyin pa byas pa de'i rgyu dang / de'i rkyen gyis rtag tu phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med mtha' yas pa'i klung gang+g'a'i bye ma snyed kyi sems can thams cad kyis bsngags shing bstod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa byas pa de'i rgyu dang / de'i rkyen gyis rtag tu phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med mtha' yas pa'i klung gang+g'a'i bye ma snyed kyi sems can thams cad kyis bsngags shing bstod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of the cause of giving and the condition of giving, one is always praised and extolled by all sentient beings in the limitless, boundless worlds of the ten directions, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can la zas byin pa ni 'tsho ba byin pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can la zas byin pa ni 'tsho ba byin pa ste /
translated: When a bodhisattva-mahāsattva gives food to sentient beings, it is giving them life.

original: de'i @437a *// 'bras bus mngon par sangs rgyas pa na rtag pa mi 'pho ba'i gnas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i @437a *// 'bras bus mngon par sangs rgyas pa na rtag pa mi 'pho ba'i gnas su 'gyur ro //
translated: By the result of that, when they fully awaken, they become the abode of permanence and immutability.

original: bde ba byin pas ni mngon par sangs rgyas pa na shin tu bde ba thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bde ba byin pas ni mngon par sangs rgyas pa na shin tu bde ba thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: By giving happiness, when they fully awaken, they attain supreme happiness.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa byin pa na chos bzhin du rnyed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa byin pa na chos bzhin du rnyed pa yin gyi /
translated: When a bodhisattva gives a gift in accordance with the Dharma,

original: gzhan la gnod pa ma yin pas mngon par sangs rgyas pa na yongs su dag pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan la gnod pa ma yin pas mngon par sangs rgyas pa na yongs su dag pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: it is not harmful to others. By that, when they fully awaken, they attain completely pure nirvāṇa.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa byin pa na sems can rnams kyi ched du ma bslangs par thob pas mngon par sangs rgyas pa na dbang sgyur ba'i bdag ces bya ba thob par 'gyur ro //🔽sbyin pa byin pa'i rkyen gyis pha rol po mthu dang ldan par gyur pas mngon par sangs rgyas pa na stobs bcu thob par 'gyur ro; ;sbyin pa byin pa'i rkyen gyis pha rol po smra ba'i spobs pa dang ldan par 'gyur bas mngon par sangs rgyas pa na
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa byin pa na sems can rnams kyi ched du ma bslangs par thob pas mngon par sangs rgyas pa na dbang sgyur ba'i bdag ces bya ba thob par 'gyur ro // sbyin pa byin pa'i rkyen gyis pha rol po mthu dang ldan par gyur pas mngon par sangs rgyas pa na stobs bcu thob par 'gyur ro; ;sbyin pa byin pa'i rkyen gyis pha rol po smra ba'i spobs pa dang ldan par 'gyur bas mngon par sangs rgyas pa na
translated: When a bodhisattva gives a gift, he does so for the sake of sentient beings, not for the sake of obtaining power. When he attains manifest perfect buddhahood, he attains the power of mastery.🔽When he gives a gift, the other person becomes powerful as a result. When he attains manifest perfect buddhahood, he attains the ten powers.

original: yang dag par so sor shes pa bzhi thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag par so sor shes pa bzhi thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: When he gives a gift, the other person becomes eloquent as a result. When he attains manifest perfect buddhahood, he attains the four forms of correct knowledge.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis sbyin pa byin pas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyur 'gyur te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis sbyin pa byin pas yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyur 'gyur te /
translated: The buddhas and bodhisattvas give gifts that become the cause of their attaining nirvana.

original: de bas na bdag kyang sbyin pa la nan tan byas te mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyur 'gyur bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na bdag kyang sbyin pa la nan tan byas te mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyur 'gyur bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, I too should practice generosity, making it the cause of my attaining nirvana.

original: rgyas par ni me tog sna tshogs zhes bya ba'i nang nas 'chad do //
analyzed: rgyas par ni me tog sna tshogs zhes bya ba'i nang nas 'chad do //
translated: This is explained in detail in the Flower Ornament Sutra.

original: de la ji ltar na lha rjes su dran pa zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na lha rjes su dran pa zhe na /
translated: What is the recollection of the gods?

original: rgyal chen ris bzhi'i gnas @437b nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched steng gi gnas yod de /
analyzed: rgyal chen ris bzhi'i gnas @437b nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched steng gi gnas yod de /
translated: There are the abodes of the gods of the four heavenly kings up to the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: gang zhig rgyal chen ris bzhi'i lha la dad pa de la'ang skal pa yod de /
analyzed: gang zhig rgyal chen ris bzhi'i lha la dad pa de la'ang skal pa yod de /
translated: Those who have faith in the gods of the four heavenly kings also have good fortune.

original: gang zhig mang du thos pa dang / sbyin pa dang / shes rab kyis rgyal chen ris bzhi'i lha nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched steng gi bar du bdag la'ang skal pa yod mod kyi /
analyzed: gang zhig mang du thos pa dang / sbyin pa dang / shes rab kyis rgyal chen ris bzhi'i lha nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched steng gi bar du bdag la'ang skal pa yod mod kyi /
translated: Those who are learned, generous, and wise have good fortune up to the gods of the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception, but I do not desire that.

original: bdag 'dod pa ma yin no; ;de ci'i phyir zhen /
analyzed: bdag 'dod pa ma yin no; ;de ci'i phyir zhen /
translated: Why is that?

original: rgyal chen ris bzhi'i lha nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched steng gi bar du thams cad kyang mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal chen ris bzhi'i lha nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched steng gi bar du thams cad kyang mi rtag pa'o //
translated: From the gods of the four heavenly kings up to the gods of the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception, all are impermanent.

original: mi rtag pa yin pas na skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba ste /
analyzed: mi rtag pa yin pas na skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba ste /
translated: Because of impermanence, there is birth, aging, sickness, and death.

original: de bas na bdag 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na bdag 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, I do not desire the self.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: dper na / sgyu ma ni skye bo glen pa dag slu ba yin te /
analyzed: dper na / sgyu ma ni skye bo glen pa dag slu ba yin te /
translated: Illusions deceive foolish people.

original: mkhas pa shes rab can ni chags pa'am slu bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mkhas pa shes rab can ni chags pa'am slu bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The wise and the intelligent are not attached to them or deceived by them.

original: sgyu ma ni rgyal chen ris bzhi'i gnas nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi steng lta bu'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma ni rgyal chen ris bzhi'i gnas nas 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi steng lta bu'o //
translated: Illusions are like the realm of the four maharajas up to the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: glen pa ni byis pa ma rabs thams cad lta bu ste; bdag ni so so'i skye bo glen pa dang mi 'dra'o //
analyzed: glen pa ni byis pa ma rabs thams cad lta bu ste; bdag ni so so'i skye bo glen pa dang mi 'dra'o //
translated: Foolish people are like all the ignorant, ordinary people. I am not like the foolish, ordinary people.

original: bdag gis sngon thos na don dam pa'i lha ste /
analyzed: bdag gis sngon thos na don dam pa'i lha ste /
translated: If I have heard it before, the ultimate gods are

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' ni rtag pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' ni rtag pa /
translated: the buddhas and bodhisattvas, who are permanent,

original: mi 'gyur ba /🔽mi skye ba /🔽mi rga ba /
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba / mi skye ba / mi rga ba /
translated: unchanging,🔽unborn,🔽not aging,

original: mi na ba /
analyzed: mi na ba /
translated: not sick,

original: mi 'chi ba yin te /
analyzed: mi 'chi ba yin te /
translated: and not dying.

original: bdag ni sems can thams cad kyi phyir don dam pa'i lha tshol lo //
analyzed: bdag ni sems can thams cad kyi phyir don dam pa'i lha tshol lo //
translated: I seek the ultimate gods for the sake of all sentient beings.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: don dam pa'i lhas ni sems can bdag gi nyon mongs @438a *//
analyzed: don dam pa'i lhas ni sems can bdag gi nyon mongs @438a *//
translated: The ultimate deity is the sentient being.🔽

original: pa yongs su gcod de /
analyzed: pa yongs su gcod de /
translated: The ultimate deity completely eliminates the afflictions of sentient beings.

original: dper na / yid bzhin gyi shing lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na / yid bzhin gyi shing lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the wish-fulfilling tree.

original: ci ste bdag la dad pa nas shes rab kyi bar du yod na don dam pa'i lha thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste bdag la dad pa nas shes rab kyi bar du yod na don dam pa'i lha thob par 'gyur te /
translated: If one has faith in the self up to wisdom, one will attain the ultimate deity.

original: sems can thams cad la'ang don dam pa'i lha rgyas par ston cing 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la'ang don dam pa'i lha rgyas par ston cing 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will also extensively teach and explain the ultimate deity to all sentient beings.

original: de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos lha rjes su dran pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos lha rjes su dran pa zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called the bodhisattva-mahāsattva's recollection of the deity.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' chen po 'jig rten pa ma yin gyi /🔽'jig rten pas ni mi shes /
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' chen po 'jig rten pa ma yin gyi / 'jig rten pas ni mi shes /
translated: in this way the bodhisattva-mahāsattva is not of the world,🔽but is not known,

original: mi mthong / mi rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: mi mthong / mi rtogs pa ste /
translated: not seen, and not realized by worldly people.

original: byang chub sems dpas shes pa; mthong ba /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas shes pa; mthong ba /
translated: The bodhisattva is said to know, see,

original: rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and realize.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: gal te nga'i nye gnas las mdo sde bcu gnyis klog pa dang / 'don pa dang / 'chang ba dang / 'dzin pa dang / glegs bam du 'dri ba dang / gzhan dag la rgya che bar ston cing 'chad pa dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo 'don pa dang /
analyzed: gal te nga'i nye gnas las mdo sde bcu gnyis klog pa dang / 'don pa dang / 'chang ba dang / 'dzin pa dang / glegs bam du 'dri ba dang / gzhan dag la rgya che bar ston cing 'chad pa dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo 'don pa dang /
translated: If my disciples recite, chant, hold, and uphold the twelve divisions of the scriptures, copy them into texts, and teach and explain them extensively to others, and if they recite, chant, hold, and uphold the Mahāparinirvāṇa-sūtra,

original: klog pa dang / 'chang ba dang / 'dzin pa dang / glegs bam du 'dri ba dang / gzhan dag la'ang rgyas par ston cing 'chad par 'dra'o zhes bya ba mi rung ngo //
analyzed: klog pa dang / 'chang ba dang / 'dzin pa dang / glegs bam du 'dri ba dang / gzhan dag la'ang rgyas par ston cing 'chad par 'dra'o zhes bya ba mi rung ngo //
translated: copy it into texts, and teach and explain it extensively to others, it would not be right to say that they are the same.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad kyi dgongs pa'i don zab mo'o //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad kyi dgongs pa'i don zab mo'o //
translated: the Mahāparinirvāṇa-sūtra is the profound intended meaning of all the blessed buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis dgongs pa'i don @438b zab mo yin pas na mchog tu gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis dgongs pa'i don @438b zab mo yin pas na mchog tu gyur pa yin no //
translated: Because it is the profound intended meaning of the blessed buddhas, it is supreme.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: de bas na yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo ni ngo mtshar rmad du che ba ste /
analyzed: de bas na yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo ni ngo mtshar rmad du che ba ste /
translated: Therefore, the Mahāparinirvāṇa-sūtra is a great wonder.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
translated: It is inconceivable.

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the bodhisattva Kāśyapa said to the Bhagavān:

original: bdag kyang yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo 'di ni ngo mtshar rmad du che ba ste /
analyzed: bdag kyang yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo 'di ni ngo mtshar rmad du che ba ste /
translated: “I also think that this Mahāparinirvāṇa-sūtra is a great wonder.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab bo snyam du bgyid do //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab bo snyam du bgyid do //
translated: It is inconceivable.”

original: sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun yang bsam gyis mi khyab /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun yang bsam gyis mi khyab /
translated: The Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha are inconceivable.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo'ang bsam gyis mi khyab bo snyam bgyid do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i mdo'ang bsam gyis mi khyab bo snyam bgyid do //
translated: The bodhisattva’s enlightenment and the Mahāparinirvāṇa-sūtra are also inconceivable.”

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Bhagavān,

original: don ci zhig gi slad du byang chub sems dpa' yang bsam gyis mi khyab bo zhes gsungs bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: don ci zhig gi slad du byang chub sems dpa' yang bsam gyis mi khyab bo zhes gsungs bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: for what reason did you say that the bodhisattva is also inconceivable?” The Bhagavān said:

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of noble family,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sus kyang ma bstan par rang byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni sus kyang ma bstan par rang byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
translated: The bodhisattva-mahāsattva generates the mind of pratyekabuddha enlightenment without being taught by anyone.

original: de ltar sems bskyed nas shin tu brtson 'grus rtsom pas gal te me chen pos lus dang / mgo tshig kyang chos rjes su dran pa btang ste /
analyzed: de ltar sems bskyed nas shin tu brtson 'grus rtsom pas gal te me chen pos lus dang / mgo tshig kyang chos rjes su dran pa btang ste /
translated: Having generated that mind, through the practice of diligence, if the great fire burns his body and head, he does not abandon the recollection of the Dharma.

original: mi gsod par mi byed do //
analyzed: mi gsod par mi byed do //
translated: He does not kill.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtag tu 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtag tu 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: The bodhisattva-mahāsattva always thinks like this:

original: bdag bskal pa grangs med tshad med pa'i bar du sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / byol song @439a *//
analyzed: bdag bskal pa grangs med tshad med pa'i bar du sems can dmyal ba dang / yi dvags dang / byol song @439a *//
translated: For countless, immeasurable eons, I have wandered through the realms of hell beings, hungry ghosts, animals,

original: gi skye gnas dang / lha dang / mir 'khor te /
analyzed: gi skye gnas dang / lha dang / mir 'khor te /
translated: gods, and humans.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mes tshig par gyur kyang gdon mi za bar nges pa'i chos gcig tsam yang mthob bo; ;nges pa'i chos zhes bya ba ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bo //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mes tshig par gyur kyang gdon mi za bar nges pa'i chos gcig tsam yang mthob bo; ;nges pa'i chos zhes bya ba ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub bo //
translated: Even though I have been burned by the fire of affliction, I have certainly attained at least one true Dharma. The true Dharma is called unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: bdag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi phyir lus dang srog la cung zad kyang phangs par mi byed do //
analyzed: bdag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi phyir lus dang srog la cung zad kyang phangs par mi byed do //
translated: I will not spare my body or life in the pursuit of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: bdag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi phyir lus 'di rdul du zhib mor btags kyang brtson 'grus rtsom pa mi gtong ngo; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: bdag ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi phyir lus 'di rdul du zhib mor btags kyang brtson 'grus rtsom pa mi gtong ngo; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: For the sake of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, I will not give up my perseverance even if my body is ground to dust. And why?

original: brtson 'grus kyi sems ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi sems ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the mind of perseverance is the cause of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Noble son,

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ma mthong bar lus dang srog kyang mi phangs na mthong ba lta ci smos te /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ma mthong bar lus dang srog kyang mi phangs na mthong ba lta ci smos te /
translated: if bodhisattvas do not spare their bodies or lives for the sake of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment even before they have seen it, what need is there to speak of when they have seen it?

original: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na byang chub sems dpa' ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o //
translated: Therefore, bodhisattvas are inconceivable.

original: gzhan yang bsams gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'khor ba'i skyon tshad med pa mthong ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang bsams gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'khor ba'i skyon tshad med pa mthong ba ni /
translated: Furthermore, “inconceivable” means that when the bodhisattva mahāsattva sees the immeasurable faults of saṃsāra,

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyis rtogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyis rtogs pa ma yin te /
translated: it is not realized by śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: de ltar 'khor ba'i skyon tshad med pa mthong yang sems can gyi phyir sdug bsngal yang yongs su myong ba la skyo bar mi byed de /
analyzed: de ltar 'khor ba'i skyon tshad med pa mthong yang sems can gyi phyir sdug bsngal yang yongs su myong ba la skyo bar mi byed de /
translated: Thus, although seeing the immeasurable faults of saṃsāra, for the sake of sentient beings, he does not become weary of experiencing suffering.

original: de bas @439b na bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas @439b na bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called “inconceivable.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can gyi phyir sems can dmyal ba na sdug bsngal mang po myong yang bsam gtan gsum pa'i bde ba dang 'dra ste /

original: mi dang / sbrul dang / bal glang dang / rta dang / bong bu dang / khyi dang / seng ge dang / phag pa dang / wa dang / spre'u'i sha ste /🔽gzhan kun gnang ngo zhes 'chad /
analyzed: mi dang / sbrul dang / bal glang dang / rta dang / bong bu dang / khyi dang / seng ge dang / phag pa dang / wa dang / spre'u'i sha ste / gzhan kun gnang ngo zhes 'chad /
translated: They are the meat of humans, snakes, elephants, horses, donkeys, dogs, lions, pigs, foxes, and monkeys.🔽They say that all other [types of meat] are allowed.

original: res 'ga' ni thams cad mi gnang ngo zhes 'chad /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni thams cad mi gnang ngo zhes 'chad /
translated: Sometimes they say that all [types of meat] are not allowed.

original: res 'ga' ni dge slong dngos po lnga byed du mi gnang bar 'chad de /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni dge slong dngos po lnga byed du mi gnang bar 'chad de /
translated: Sometimes it explains that monks are not allowed to perform five things.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: mi dang / mtshon dang / chang dang / zho dang / 'bru mar 'tshong du mi gnang ste /
analyzed: mi dang / mtshon dang / chang dang / zho dang / 'bru mar 'tshong du mi gnang ste /
translated: They are not allowed to sell people, weapons, alcohol, yogurt, or oil.

original: de ma yin pa gzhan kun gnang bar 'chad /
analyzed: de ma yin pa gzhan kun gnang bar 'chad /
translated: It explains that they are allowed to do everything else.

original: res 'ga' ni gnas rnam pa lngar 'gror mi gnang ste /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni gnas rnam pa lngar 'gror mi gnang ste /
translated: Sometimes it explains that monks are not allowed to go to five kinds of places.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: shan pa dang / sprul 'tshong ma dang / chang 'tshong ma dang / rgyal po'i pho brang dang / rigs ngan gyi khyim ste /
analyzed: shan pa dang / sprul 'tshong ma dang / chang 'tshong ma dang / rgyal po'i pho brang dang / rigs ngan gyi khyim ste /
translated: They are the homes of butchers, snake charmers, prostitutes, kings, and low caste people.

original: gzhan du 'gror @450b gnang bar 'chad /
analyzed: gzhan du 'gror @450b gnang bar 'chad /
translated: It explains that they are allowed to go everywhere else.

original: res 'ga' ni gos ki'u sha ya bgor mi gnang ste /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni gos ki'u sha ya bgor mi gnang ste /
translated: Sometimes it explains that monks are not allowed to wear kīrveya robes.

original: gzhan thams cad gnang bar 'chad /
analyzed: gzhan thams cad gnang bar 'chad /
translated: It explains that they are allowed to wear everything else.

original: res 'ga' ni de bzhin gshegs pas dge slong rnams la gos dang / zas dang / mal cha'i zong gser srang khri phrag bcu ri ba 'chang du gnang bar 'chad /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni de bzhin gshegs pas dge slong rnams la gos dang / zas dang / mal cha'i zong gser srang khri phrag bcu ri ba 'chang du gnang bar 'chad /
translated: Sometimes it explains that the Tathāgata allowed monks to possess the value of ten million ounces of gold in robes, food, and bedding.

original: res 'ga' ni mi gnang bar 'chad /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni mi gnang bar 'chad /
translated: Sometimes it explains that he did not allow that.

original: res 'ga' ni mya ngan las 'das pa rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang / yongs su dag par 'chad /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni mya ngan las 'das pa rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang / yongs su dag par 'chad /
translated: Sometimes they explain nirvāṇa as permanent, blissful, a self, and pure.

original: res 'ga' ni mya ngan las 'das pa kun nas nyon mongs pa zad pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: res 'ga' ni mya ngan las 'das pa kun nas nyon mongs pa zad pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Sometimes they explain nirvāṇa as not the exhaustion of afflictions,

original: chos gzhan gang yang mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba med do //
analyzed: chos gzhan gang yang mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba med do //
translated: but as the nonexistence of any other phenomenon called nirvāṇa.

original: dper na / skud pa btags pa ni gos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dper na / skud pa btags pa ni gos zhes bya'o //
translated: For example, when threads are woven together, they are called a ‘cloth.’

original: gos zhig nas gos med ces bya ste /🔽chos gzhan la gos med do //
analyzed: gos zhig nas gos med ces bya ste / chos gzhan la gos med do //
translated: When the cloth is destroyed, it is said that there is no cloth.

original: zhes bya ba med de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba med de /
translated: But there is no other phenomenon called ‘non-cloth.’

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid kyang de dang 'dra'o //🔽zhes 'chad do; ;rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid kyang de dang 'dra'o // zhes 'chad do; ;rigs kyi bu /
translated: The characteristics of nirvāṇa are also like that.”

original: de'i tshe de'i dus na nga'i nye gnas rnams bden par 'chad pa ni nyung /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dus na nga'i nye gnas rnams bden par 'chad pa ni nyung /
translated: “Noble son, at that time, my disciples were few who taught the truth,

original: log par 'chad pa ni mang /
analyzed: log par 'chad pa ni mang /
translated: but many who taught falsely.

original: bden pa'i chos 'dzin pa ni nyung /
analyzed: bden pa'i chos 'dzin pa ni nyung /
translated: They were few who upheld the true Dharma,

original: log pa'i chos 'dzin pa ni mang /
analyzed: log pa'i chos 'dzin pa ni mang /
translated: but many who upheld false teachings.

original: sangs rgyas kyi bka' 'dzin pa ni nyung /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bka' 'dzin pa ni nyung /
translated: They were few who upheld the Buddha’s words,

original: bdud kyi tshig 'dzin pa ni mang ngo //
analyzed: bdud kyi tshig 'dzin pa ni mang ngo //
translated: but many who upheld the words of Māra.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: de'i tshe na yul koo shambhi na nye gnas gnyis yod de /🔽gcig ni dgra bcom pa'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe na yul koo shambhi na nye gnas gnyis yod de / gcig ni dgra bcom pa'o //
translated: at that time in the country of Kauśāmbī there were two disciples.🔽One was an arhat,

original: gcig ni tshul khrims bshig pa'o //
analyzed: gcig ni tshul khrims bshig pa'o //
translated: and the other had broken his vows.

original: de la tshul khrims bshig pa'i 'khor ni lnga brgyad yod //
analyzed: de la tshul khrims bshig pa'i 'khor ni lnga brgyad yod //
translated: The one who had broken his vows had a retinue of five hundred,

original: dgra bcom pa'i 'khor ni brgya yod de /🔽tshul khrims bshig pas ni de bzhin gshegs pa mthar yongs su mya @451a *//
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i 'khor ni brgya yod de / tshul khrims bshig pas ni de bzhin gshegs pa mthar yongs su mya @451a *//
translated: and the arhat had a retinue of one hundred.

original: ngan las 'das ba'o //
analyzed: ngan las 'das ba'o //
translated: The one who had broken his vows said to the Tathāgata, ‘I will go to the end of the world and pass into parinirvāṇa.’

original: bdag gis 'di bzhin du bcom ldan 'das las don 'di thos te /
analyzed: bdag gis 'di bzhin du bcom ldan 'das las don 'di thos te /
translated: ‘I heard this from the Blessed One:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rtsa ba bzhi bcas pa sdom na'ang rung /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rtsa ba bzhi bcas pa sdom na'ang rung /
translated: “If the Tathāgata breaks the four root vows, it is all right.

original: gal te zhig na'ang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gal te zhig na'ang nyes pa med do //
translated: If he breaks them, there is no fault.”

original: bdag kyang da ltar dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu dang / thog ma med pa'i ye shes bzhi thob pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag kyang da ltar dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu dang / thog ma med pa'i ye shes bzhi thob pa yin te /
translated: I have now attained the fruit of arhatship and the four primordial wisdoms.

original: dgra bcom pa'ang rtsa ba bzhi po de dag bshig go /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'ang rtsa ba bzhi po de dag bshig go /
translated: The arhat also broke the four root vows.

original: rtsa ba bzhi po'i chos de yang dag par sdig pa zhig na dgra bcom pas 'dral ba'i mi rigs so //
analyzed: rtsa ba bzhi po'i chos de yang dag par sdig pa zhig na dgra bcom pas 'dral ba'i mi rigs so //
translated: If the four basic rules are truly transgressed, then it is right to break them, as the Arhats did.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten na bzhugs pa'i tshe ni shin tu sdoms shig ces bka' stsal /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten na bzhugs pa'i tshe ni shin tu sdoms shig ces bka' stsal /
translated: When the Tathagata is in the world, one should be very strict.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshe ni thams cad gtong ngo zhes zer /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i tshe ni thams cad gtong ngo zhes zer /
translated: When he has entered Nirvana, one may be more lax.

original: de la dgra bcom pa la sogs pa'i dge slong rnams kyis smras pa /
analyzed: de la dgra bcom pa la sogs pa'i dge slong rnams kyis smras pa /
translated: The monks, Arhats, and so on, said to them:

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag /
translated: Venerable Ones,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mthar yongs su mya ngan las 'das so zhes bya ba'i mi rigs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mthar yongs su mya ngan las 'das so zhes bya ba'i mi rigs so //
translated: it is not right to say that the Tathagata has finally entered Nirvana.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtag pa mi 'gyur mi 'pho bar bdag cag shes te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtag pa mi 'gyur mi 'pho bar bdag cag shes te /
translated: We know that the Tathagata is eternal, unchanging, and immutable.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten na bzhugs pa dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'og tu rtsa ba bzhi bshig pa'i sdig pa ni khyad par med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten na bzhugs pa dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i 'og tu rtsa ba bzhi bshig pa'i sdig pa ni khyad par med do //
translated: Whether the Tathagata is in the world or has entered Nirvana, there is no difference in the sin of breaking the four basic rules.

original: de ltar dgra bcom pa'ang sdom pa'i rtsa ba bshig go zhes bya bar mi rung ngo /
analyzed: de ltar dgra bcom pa'ang sdom pa'i rtsa ba bshig go zhes bya bar mi rung ngo /
translated: Thus, it is not right to say that even an arhat destroys the root of the precepts.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'ang sdom pa mi 'jig na dgra bcom pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'ang sdom pa mi 'jig na dgra bcom pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: If a stream-enterer does not destroy the precepts, then what need is there to speak of an arhat?

original: gal te tshe dang ldan pa khyed bdag dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob ces zer na /
analyzed: gal te tshe dang ldan pa khyed bdag dgra bcom pa'i 'bras bu thob ces zer na /
translated: If you venerable ones say, 'We have attained the fruit of arhatship,'

original: dgra @451b bcom pa ni bdag dag bcom pa yin no zhes bya ba'i 'du shes mi skyed do //
analyzed: dgra @451b bcom pa ni bdag dag bcom pa yin no zhes bya ba'i 'du shes mi skyed do //
translated: do not give rise to the notion that an arhat is one who has destroyed the self.

original: dgra bcom pa ni dge ba 'ba' zhig 'chad de /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa ni dge ba 'ba' zhig 'chad de /
translated: An arhat only cuts off what is virtuous,

original: mi dge ba mi 'chad na /
analyzed: mi dge ba mi 'chad na /
translated: but does not cut off what is unvirtuous.

original: tshe dang ldan pas bshad do cog ni chos ma yin pa sha stag ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pas bshad do cog ni chos ma yin pa sha stag ste /
translated: All that the venerable ones explain is nothing but non-Dharma.

original: gal te gang mdo sde bcu gnyis mthong bas ni tshe dang ldan pa dag nges par dgra bcom pa ma yin par rig go /
analyzed: gal te gang mdo sde bcu gnyis mthong bas ni tshe dang ldan pa dag nges par dgra bcom pa ma yin par rig go /
translated: If one sees the twelve divisions of the sūtras, one knows that the venerable ones are definitely not arhats.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: de'i tshe na tshul khrims 'dral ba'i 'khor rnams kyis dgra bcom pa de'i srog gi 'tsho ba gcod do //
analyzed: de'i tshe na tshul khrims 'dral ba'i 'khor rnams kyis dgra bcom pa de'i srog gi 'tsho ba gcod do //
translated: at that time, the assembly that was breaking the precepts will take the life of that arhat.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: de'i tshe na bdud sdig can gyis dge 'dun sde gnyis khros 'khrugs pa'i sems su gyur pa'i skabs su dge slong drug brgya po de dag la rab tu gnod par gtses so //
analyzed: de'i tshe na bdud sdig can gyis dge 'dun sde gnyis khros 'khrugs pa'i sems su gyur pa'i skabs su dge slong drug brgya po de dag la rab tu gnod par gtses so //
translated: At that time, the evil Māra, knowing that the two groups of monks were angry and upset, caused six hundred monks to be killed.

original: de nas skye bo ma rabs rnams kyis so so nas 'di skad du ngo mtshar to //
analyzed: de nas skye bo ma rabs rnams kyis so so nas 'di skad du ngo mtshar to //
translated: Then the vulgar people each said, “How strange!

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ni nub bo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ni nub bo //
translated: The Buddha’s Dharma has disappeared!

original: zad do // zhes zer te /
analyzed: zad do // zhes zer te /
translated: It is exhausted!”

original: yang dag par na nga'i dam pa'i chos ni ma nub ste /
analyzed: yang dag par na nga'i dam pa'i chos ni ma nub ste /
translated: But in truth, my true Dharma has not disappeared.

original: de'i tshe na yul de na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po khri phrag bcu gnyis nga'i chos shin tu 'dzin na /
analyzed: de'i tshe na yul de na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po khri phrag bcu gnyis nga'i chos shin tu 'dzin na /
translated: At that time, in that land there were twelve myriads of virtuous upāsakas who upheld my Dharma.

original: ci ste nga'i chos nub ces bya /
analyzed: ci ste nga'i chos nub ces bya /
translated: How could it be said that my Dharma has disappeared?

original: de'i tshe de'i dus na dzambu'i gling du nga'i nye gnas su gyur pa'i dge slong gcig kyang med nas /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dus na dzambu'i gling du nga'i nye gnas su gyur pa'i dge slong gcig kyang med nas /
translated: At that time, there was not a single monk in Jambudvīpa who was my disciple.

original: de nas bdud sdig to can gyis me po che bus nas mdo sde thams cad bsregs so //
analyzed: de nas bdud sdig to can gyis me po che bus nas mdo sde thams cad bsregs so //
translated: Then the evil Māra set fire to a great pyre and burned all the sūtras.

original: de la cung zad lus pa dag ni bram ze rnams kyis mdo mdor brkus nas kho ba dag gi gzhung du bstan te /
analyzed: de la cung zad lus pa dag ni bram ze rnams kyis mdo mdor brkus nas kho ba dag gi gzhung du bstan te /
translated: The remainder of the Vedas were stolen by the Brahmins and taught as their own scriptures.

original: de lta bas na sangs rgyas ma byung ba'i sngon logs su byang chub sems dpa' phra mo rnams gcig gis gcig drangs te /
analyzed: de lta bas na sangs rgyas ma byung ba'i sngon logs su byang chub sems dpa' phra mo rnams gcig gis gcig drangs te /
translated: Therefore, before the Buddha appeared, the lesser bodhisattvas were attracted to one another

original: bram ze'i tshig la mos shing 'dzin to //
analyzed: bram ze'i tshig la mos shing 'dzin to //
translated: and believed in and upheld the words of the Brahmins.

original: bram ze rnams 'di @452a *//
analyzed: bram ze rnams 'di @452a *//
translated: The Brahmins say,

original: skad du bdag la dus khrims yod do zhes zer mod kyi /
analyzed: skad du bdag la dus khrims yod do zhes zer mod kyi /
translated: “We have the rules of the Vedas.”

original: yang dag par na mu stegs can la yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par na mu stegs can la yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But in reality, the tīrthikas do not have them.

original: mu stegs can rnams bdag dang bde ba dang / yongs su dag pa yod do zhes smra mod kyi //
analyzed: mu stegs can rnams bdag dang bde ba dang / yongs su dag pa yod do zhes smra mod kyi //
translated: The tīrthikas say, “We have a self, happiness, and purity,”

original: yang dag par na bdag dang / bde ba dang / yongs su dag pa'i don mi shes te /
analyzed: yang dag par na bdag dang / bde ba dang / yongs su dag pa'i don mi shes te /
translated: but in reality they do not understand the meaning of self, happiness, and purity.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos las yi ge 'bru gcig dang / gnyis dang / tshig gcig dang / gnyis bzung ste bshad nas nga'i gzhung la don 'di lta bu yod do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos las yi ge 'bru gcig dang / gnyis dang / tshig gcig dang / gnyis bzung ste bshad nas nga'i gzhung la don 'di lta bu yod do zhes zer ro //
translated: They have taken one or two syllables and one or two phrases from the Buddha’s teachings, explained them, and say, “This is the meaning in my scriptures.”

original: de nas de'i tshe grong khyer rtsva mchog s'a la'i shing drung na 'khor mang po tshad med mtha' yas pa snyed kyi de skad du smras pa thos nas thams cad kyis 'di skad du 'jig rten stongs so //
analyzed: de nas de'i tshe grong khyer rtsva mchog s'a la'i shing drung na 'khor mang po tshad med mtha' yas pa snyed kyi de skad du smras pa thos nas thams cad kyis 'di skad du 'jig rten stongs so //
translated: At that time, the countless and limitless assembly of followers in the city of Kuśinagara, under the Sāla trees, heard these words and all said, The world is empty!

original: 'jig rten stongs so //🔽zhes smras so //
analyzed: 'jig rten stongs so // zhes smras so //
translated: The world is empty!

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis 'khor mang po rnams la smras pa /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'od srung gis 'khor mang po rnams la smras pa /
translated: Kāśyapa Bodhisattva said to the great assembly,

original: khyed re zhig ngud mo dang / mi dga' bar ma byed cig /
analyzed: khyed re zhig ngud mo dang / mi dga' bar ma byed cig /
translated: You should not cry and be unhappy.

original: 'jig rten mi stongs kyi /
analyzed: 'jig rten mi stongs kyi /
translated: The world is not empty.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi 'gyur mi 'pho bar rtag tu gnas te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni mi 'gyur mi 'pho bar rtag tu gnas te /
translated: The Tathāgata is unchanging and always abides.

original: chos dang / dge 'dun yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: chos dang / dge 'dun yang de bzhin no //
translated: The Dharma and the Saṃgha are also like this.

original: de nas 'khor mang po de dag gis de skad ces smras pa thos nas ngud mo btang ste /
analyzed: de nas 'khor mang po de dag gis de skad ces smras pa thos nas ngud mo btang ste /
translated: Then, the great assembly, having heard these words, stopped crying

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par gyur to //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed par gyur to //
translated: and gave rise to the mind set on unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: de'i tshe rgyal po'i khab na rgyal po ma skyes dgra zhes bya ba /
analyzed: de'i tshe rgyal po'i khab na rgyal po ma skyes dgra zhes bya ba /
translated: At that time, in Rājagṛha, there was a king named Ajātaśatru,

original: rang bzhin gyis khro la gtum pa /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis khro la gtum pa /
translated: He was naturally wrathful and violent.

original: sems can gyi srog gcod pa la @452b dga' ba /
analyzed: sems can gyi srog gcod pa la @452b dga' ba /
translated: He delighted in taking the lives of sentient beings.

original: ngag mi dge ba'i las bzhi po rdzogs par byed pa /
analyzed: ngag mi dge ba'i las bzhi po rdzogs par byed pa /
translated: He completed the four kinds of verbal nonvirtuous actions.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi sems shin tu mched pa /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi sems shin tu mched pa /
translated: He had a mind that was greatly inflamed with desire, hatred, and ignorance.

original: da ltar gyi 'ba' zhig la lta'i /
analyzed: da ltar gyi 'ba' zhig la lta'i /
translated: He only looked at the present.

original: phyi ma ma 'ongs pa'i dus mi mthong ba /
analyzed: phyi ma ma 'ongs pa'i dus mi mthong ba /
translated: He did not see the future.

original: 'khor shin tu ngan pa la brten pa /
analyzed: 'khor shin tu ngan pa la brten pa /
translated: He relied on a very bad retinue.

original: da ltar gyi 'dod pa lnga la chags pas rgyal po yab kyang nyes pa med par bsad do //
analyzed: da ltar gyi 'dod pa lnga la chags pas rgyal po yab kyang nyes pa med par bsad do //
translated: Because of his attachment to the five present desires, he killed his father, the king, without cause.

original: de ltar pha bsad pas 'gyod pa'i sems skyes nas mya ngan gyis gdungs pas lus kyi rgyan rnams dang / rol mo'ang btang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar pha bsad pas 'gyod pa'i sems skyes nas mya ngan gyis gdungs pas lus kyi rgyan rnams dang / rol mo'ang btang ngo //
translated: Because he killed his father, he felt regret and was tormented by grief. He gave away his ornaments and musical instruments.

original: 'gyod pa'i sems kyis gdungs pas lus khyab par 'brum bu mang po 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'gyod pa'i sems kyis gdungs pas lus khyab par 'brum bu mang po 'byung ngo //
translated: Because he was tormented by regret, many boils appeared all over his body.

original: 'brum bu'ang bsnyen mi bzod pa tsam du mnam pas de 'di snyam du bsams so //
analyzed: 'brum bu'ang bsnyen mi bzod pa tsam du mnam pas de 'di snyam du bsams so //
translated: The boils were so foul-smelling that he could not bear to be near them. He thought this:

original: bdag gi las ni 'phral du'ang rnam par smin la /
analyzed: bdag gi las ni 'phral du'ang rnam par smin la /
translated: “My karma has ripened immediately.

original: sems can dmyal ba'i rnam par smin pa'ang ring po mi thogs so snyam sems par gyur to //
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba'i rnam par smin pa'ang ring po mi thogs so snyam sems par gyur to //
translated: I fear that the retribution of hell will not be long in coming.”

analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: shin tu rlung gis btab pa bzhin //

analyzed: rgyal po 'di ltar shin tu ngom zung gnag pa ni /

analyzed: sems na bar gyur /

original: rgyal pos smras pa /
analyzed: rgyal pos smras pa /

analyzed: bdag gi lus dang sems mi na ba'i gtol ga la zhig yod /

analyzed: rgyal po yab bdag la shin tu byams shing brtse bas nyes pa'i skyon med de /

original: thog ma mtshan mkhan la bstan pa na /
analyzed: thog ma mtshan mkhan la bstan pa na /
translated: When I was first shown to the astrologers,🔽the astrologers said, “Your son will kill his father.”

analyzed: mtshan mkhan gyis kyang khyod kyi bu skyes nas pha gsod par 'gyur ro zhes smras te; de skad ces thos mod kyi /

translated: or kills someone who has developed the aspiration to enlightenment,

analyzed: pha bsad na gang zag de ni gdon mi za bar mtshams med pa'i sems can @456a *//
translated: If one kills one’s father, that person will certainly fall into the Avīci Hell.

original: dmyal bar ltung zhes thos na /
analyzed: dmyal bar ltung zhes thos na /
translated: I have heard this.

original: bdag da lus dang sems mi na ba'i gtol ga la yod /
analyzed: bdag da lus dang sems mi na ba'i gtol ga la yod /
translated: How can I be sure that my body and mind will not be harmed?

original: blon po chen po des smras pa /
analyzed: blon po chen po des smras pa /
translated: The great minister said,

original: rgyal po chen po /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po /
translated: “Great king,

analyzed: re zhig mya ngan ma byed cig /

analyzed: rgyal po yab rnam par grol ba'i lam la nan tan byed pa zhig yin pa las bsad na sdig par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the king was killed while he was diligently practicing the path to liberation, then it would be a sin.

original: gal te rgyal po'i srid kyi phyir bsad na sdig par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te rgyal po'i srid kyi phyir bsad na sdig par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If he was killed for the sake of the king’s rule, then it would not be a sin.

original: rgyal po chen po /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po /
translated: Great king,

original: chos ma yin pa ni chos ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos ma yin pa ni chos ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: what is not Dharma is called ‘not Dharma.’

original: chos med pa'ang chos med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: chos med pa'ang chos med pa zhes bya ste /

original: dper na / bu med pa la bu yod do zhes bya ba dang 'dra bar /
analyzed: dper na / bu med pa la bu yod do zhes bya ba dang 'dra bar /
translated: For example, it is like saying that someone who has no son has a son.

original: bu ngan pa yod pa la bu med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: bu ngan pa yod pa la bu med pa zhes bya ste /

original: de ltar bu med pa'o zhes bya mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar bu med pa'o zhes bya mod kyi /

original: yang dag par na bu med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par na bu med pa ma yin no //

analyzed: dper na / zas kyi nang na lan tshva med na lan tshva med do zhes bya ba dang 'dra bar /

analyzed: lan tshva mi bro na'ang lan tshva med do zhes bya ba dang / dper na /

analyzed: chu med pa la chu med do zhes bya ba dang / 'dra bar /

analyzed: chu cung zad yod pa la'ang chu med do zhes bya ba dang / dper na /

analyzed: mi zhig sdug bsngal myong na bde ba med do zhes bya ba dang 'dra bar dga' ba cung zad tsam myong ba'ang de la bde ba med pa zhes bya ba dang / dper na /
translated: And just as it is said that “there is no happiness” when a person experiences suffering, it is also said that “there is no happiness” when one experiences only a little pleasure.

analyzed: dbang du ma gyur pa la @456b ni nga rgyal med do zhes bya ba dang 'dra bar dbang cung zad tsam yod kyang nga rgyal med pa'i zhes bya ba dang / dper na / nam sros na nyi ma med do zhes bya ba dang 'dra bar /
translated: It is like saying, ‘There is no pride in those who are not in control.’🔽It is like saying, ‘When night falls, there is no sun.’

original: nyi ma sprin gyis chod na'ang nyi ma med do zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nyi ma sprin gyis chod na'ang nyi ma med do zhes bya ste /

original: rgyal po chen po /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po /

analyzed: chos cung zad tsam yod pa la'ang chos med pa zhes bya ste /

original: yang dag par na chos med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par na chos med pa ma yin no //
translated: In reality, it is not the case that there is no Dharma.

original: rgyal po chen po /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po /
translated: Great King,

original: bdag gis gsol ba'i tshig 'di nyon cig /
analyzed: bdag gis gsol ba'i tshig 'di nyon cig /

original: sems can thams cad la las lhag ma zhes bya ba yod de /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la las lhag ma zhes bya ba yod de /

analyzed: las kyis dbang gis yang dang yang du 'khor bar 'khor bar gyur to //
translated: By the power of karma, they revolve again and again in the cycle of existence.

analyzed: gal te rgyal po yab la'ang las lhag ma zhes bya ba yod na /

analyzed: da rgyal pos bsad kyang sdig par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: even if the king kills him now, it will not be a sin.

original: rgyal po chen po /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po /
translated: Great King,

original: re zhig mya ngan bsang du gsol //
analyzed: re zhig mya ngan bsang du gsol //
translated: For a while, please dispel your grief.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?🔽If you always grieve,

analyzed: rtag tu mya ngan gang byed pa; ;mya ngan phyir zhing skye bar 'gyur //
translated: grief will arise again and again.

original: ji ltar gnyid la dga' ba yang /
analyzed: ji ltar gnyid la dga' ba yang /

analyzed: phyir zhing de bzhin gnyid cher 'gyur //
translated: will sleep more and more,🔽so it is with attachment and craving

analyzed: de bzhin 'dod chags sred pa dang // chang dad che ba'ang rig par bya //
translated: and with a fondness for alcohol.

analyzed: rgyal po gsung ba ltar 'jig rten na lus dang sems kyi nad gso ba'i sman pa med ces byar mi rung ste /
translated: “It is not right to say that there is no doctor in the world to cure the physical and mental illnesses of the body, as the king said.

analyzed: da ltar ston pa chen po be ra ta'i bu kun rgyal zhes bya ba thams cad mkhyen pa /
translated: There is now the great teacher called Pūraṇa Kāśyapa, who is omniscient,

original: gzi brjid chen po dang ldan pa /

analyzed: mngon par shes pa chen po dang ldan zhing sems can thams cad @457a *//

translated: The Great Teacher alone knows and sees all dharmas that are not known, not seen, and not realized by all sentient beings. Now, dwelling in Rājagṛha, he teaches the Dharma to many disciples like this:

analyzed: 'khor mang po'i nang du gal te rgyal po dbang du gyur pa dag yid bzhin du dge ba dang / sdig pa'i las byed pa de sdig pa mang po byas kyang kha na ma tho ba'i sdig par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: 'In the midst of the great assembly, if those who have become kings act virtuously or sinfully as they wish, even if they commit many sins, they will not be sinful transgressions.

original: dper na / me chen pos 'tshig pa na gtsang ba'am mi gtsang ba zhes bya ba med de /
analyzed: dper na / me chen pos 'tshig pa na gtsang ba'am mi gtsang ba zhes bya ba med de /
translated: For example, when burned by a great fire, there is no such thing as clean or unclean.

original: rgyal po'ang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: rgyal po'ang de dang 'dra'o //

analyzed: dper na / sa chen po ni gtsang ba dang mi gtsang ba thams cad kyi gnas su gyur te /
translated: For example, the great earth is the abode of all clean and unclean things.

original: de lta bu'i las byed kyang zhe sdang ba dang dga' ba med do //
analyzed: de lta bu'i las byed kyang zhe sdang ba dang dga' ba med do //
translated: Even though such actions are done, there is no aversion or delight.

original: rgyal po chen po'ang sa chen po dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po'ang sa chen po dang 'dra ste /
translated: The great king is also like the great earth.

original: zhe sdang ba dang dga' ba zhes bya ba med do //
analyzed: zhe sdang ba dang dga' ba zhes bya ba med do //
translated: There is no such thing as being angry or pleased.

original: dper na / chu dang ba ni gtsang ba dang mi gtsang ba thams cad bkrus kyang de la dga' ba dang mi dga' ba med de /
analyzed: dper na / chu dang ba ni gtsang ba dang mi gtsang ba thams cad bkrus kyang de la dga' ba dang mi dga' ba med de /
translated: For example, clear water washes away all that is clean and unclean, and it is neither pleased nor displeased by that.

original: rgyal po chen po'ang chu dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po'ang chu dang 'dra'o //
translated: Great King, you are like water.

original: dper na / rlung ni gtsang ba dang mi gtsang ba thams cad 'phyag go /
analyzed: dper na / rlung ni gtsang ba dang mi gtsang ba thams cad 'phyag go /
translated: For example, the wind blows away all that is clean and unclean.

original: de ltar de lta bu'i las byed kyang de la ni dga' ba dang mi dga' ba med de /
analyzed: de ltar de lta bu'i las byed kyang de la ni dga' ba dang mi dga' ba med de /
translated: Even though it performs such actions, it is neither pleased nor displeased by that.

original: rgyal po chen po'ang rlung dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po'ang rlung dang 'dra'o //
translated: Great King, you are like the wind.

original: dper na / ston shing bcad na dbyar phyir skye'o //
analyzed: dper na / ston shing bcad na dbyar phyir skye'o //
translated: For example, if you cut down a tree in the autumn, it will grow again in the summer.

original: de ltar shing bcad kyang yang dag par na @457b sdig par mi 'gyur ba dang 'dra bar sems can thams cad kyang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: de ltar shing bcad kyang yang dag par na @457b sdig par mi 'gyur ba dang 'dra bar sems can thams cad kyang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Even though the tree is cut down, it is not really a sin. In the same way, all sentient beings are like that.

original: 'di nas tshe 'phos nas phyir mang 'dir skye'o //
analyzed: 'di nas tshe 'phos nas phyir mang 'dir skye'o //
translated: After they die, they are reborn here again.

original: de ltar phyir yang 'dir skye bas na sdig par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar phyir yang 'dir skye bas na sdig par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since they are reborn here again, it is not a sin.

original: sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal dang bde ba'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa bdag la dbang med de /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal dang bde ba'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa bdag la dbang med de /
translated: The results of the suffering and happiness of all sentient beings are not under my control.

original: da ltar gyi dus na las rnam par smin pa'ang sngon 'das pa'i dus kyi rgyu la rag lus te /
analyzed: da ltar gyi dus na las rnam par smin pa'ang sngon 'das pa'i dus kyi rgyu la rag lus te /
translated: Even the ripening of karma in the present time depends on the causes of the past.

original: da ltar gyi dus na rnam par smin pa ni da ltar gyi dus na rgyu med de /
analyzed: da ltar gyi dus na rnam par smin pa ni da ltar gyi dus na rgyu med de /
translated: In the present time, there is no cause for the ripening of karma in the present time.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na'ang 'bras bu rnam par smin pa med do //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na'ang 'bras bu rnam par smin pa med do //
translated: In the future time, there is no ripening of the result.

original: da ltar gyi 'bras bu nyid smin pas na /
analyzed: da ltar gyi 'bras bu nyid smin pas na /
translated: Because the result of the present time ripens,

original: so so'i skye bo dag tshul khrims srung ba dang / brtson 'grus rtsom pa'ang da ltar gyi dus kyi sdig par 'gyur ba'i 'bras bu bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dag tshul khrims srung ba dang / brtson 'grus rtsom pa'ang da ltar gyi dus kyi sdig par 'gyur ba'i 'bras bu bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ordinary beings guard morality and exert themselves in effort in order to avert the result that would be the present time's misdeed.

original: tshul khrims bsrungs pas zag pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims bsrungs pas zag pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: By guarding morality, they become free from defilements.

original: zag pa med pas zag pa dang bcas pa'i las med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zag pa med pas zag pa dang bcas pa'i las med par 'gyur ro //
translated: By being free from defilements, they become free from karma with defilements.

original: de ltar las zad pas na sdug bsngal mang po'ang zad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar las zad pas na sdug bsngal mang po'ang zad par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that way, by exhausting karma, they also exhaust much suffering.

original: sdug bsngal mang po zad pas na rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro zhes ston pa de'i gan du myur du bzhud cig /
analyzed: sdug bsngal mang po zad pas na rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro zhes ston pa de'i gan du myur du bzhud cig /
translated: He will teach you how to end your many sufferings and attain complete liberation.

original: lus dang sems sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba'i nad kyang 'tsho la /
analyzed: lus dang sems sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba'i nad kyang 'tsho la /
translated: He will cure you of the disease that afflicts your body and mind.

original: de dang phrad na sdig pa'ang yongs su 'byang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dang phrad na sdig pa'ang yongs su 'byang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When you meet him, you will be completely purified of your evil deeds.

original: rgyal po chen pos smras pa /
analyzed: rgyal po chen pos smras pa /
translated: The king said,

original: de ltar bdag gi sdig pa nges par 'byang bar 'gyur na lta de la skyabs su 'gro bar bya'o zhes smras so //🔽de nas yang blon po @458a *//
analyzed: de ltar bdag gi sdig pa nges par 'byang bar 'gyur na lta de la skyabs su 'gro bar bya'o zhes smras so // de nas yang blon po @458a *//
translated: “If my evil deeds can be purified in this way, I will go to him for refuge.”

original: chen po don thams cad shes pa zhes bya ba zhig rgyal po'i drung du 'ongs nas 'di skad ces gsol to //

analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das ni rtag tu 'di skad ces gsung ngo //
translated: the Blessed Buddha always teaches this:

original: rnam par dga' ba'i chos 'di gnyis kyis sems can gyi mgon dang skyabs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par dga' ba'i chos 'di gnyis kyis sems can gyi mgon dang skyabs su 'gyur ro //
translated: ‘There are two factors of joy that serve as a refuge and protection for sentient beings.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two?

original: khrel ba dang / 'dzem pa'o //🔽'dzem pa ni bdag kha na ma tho ba'i las mi byed do //

original: khrel ba ni gzhan byed du mi 'dzud pa'o //
analyzed: khrel ba ni gzhan byed du mi 'dzud pa'o //
translated: Shame is not to let others do it.

analyzed: 'dzem pa ni bdag ngo tsha @466a *// bar byed pa'o //
translated: A sense of decency is to be ashamed of oneself.

analyzed: khrel ba ni pha rol la 'gyod cing mthol ba'o //
translated: Shame is to feel remorse and confess to others.

original: 'dzem pa ni mi la ngo tsha ba'o //
analyzed: 'dzem pa ni mi la ngo tsha ba'o //
translated: A sense of decency is to be ashamed in the presence of people.

original: khrel ba ni lha la ngo tsha ba ste /
analyzed: khrel ba ni lha la ngo tsha ba ste /
